We must hurry and build more trading posts. Without them, we are lost.
Move faster! Our men are wilting without the proper supplies. Open the road!
Ishida still holds the road. Drive a wedge into his positions and then crack them open.
The Tokaido Road is our only objective. We must establish a trade route, and quickly!
Hold on for a few moments longer! The enemy grows weak!
The western army has stolen back its position. Re-form ranks and prepare for a counterattack.
Defeat this guardian to collect its treasure.
That's it! We own the road once more. This time, we must hold it or die trying.
Catch your breath, men. The road belongs to Tokugawa. Your deeds will not be forgotten.
We must not waste any more time. Destroy those enemy barracks!
How dare the villagers of Owari fight back! Kill them, every man, woman, and child.
A Japanese villager that does not eat meat. Gathers all other resources.

This morning, Daimyo Toyotomi Hideyoshi, the man who sought to unify our divided and weary country, passed away. Where there is now peace, war will blossom. The time has come for Japan to submit to a new master.

Many weep for Toyotomi, but they should save their tears. One man will still unite this country. My master, Tokugawa Ieyasu, most powerful of the daimyo, has sent me to Osaka Castle to seize the power that rightfully belongs to him. An empire dawns today.

As expected, the daimyo have fractured into two armies, those loyal to the peace, and those in the service of my lord, Tokugawa. As I write, eastern clans under Uesugi Kagekatsu drop their plows and take up swords against us. There are enemies at every turn.

The war rages endlessly on. Doubt and weariness consume me. The master has ordered me west to capture the Tokaido Road. Whichever army holds this vital supply line holds the advantage. I will obey, as always, but I cannot ignore the chill that grips my heart.

I have few words. Lies always litter a battlefield, but this, this lie cuts too deeply. With a heavy spirit, I lead my men to their dooms at Fushimi Castle. There, 30,000 enemies will fall upon them like the stones of an avalanche. As for me, I struggle under a different weight: the truth.

I watch the sun rise over the village of Sekigahara, and I wonder what morning will bring. Two paths now wait at my feet. One holds the truth of who I was. The other holds the truth of who I have become. The choice is mine alone, and the master waits.

National Wonder: Boosts all gather rates by 10%. Produces Iron Troops or Trade.
Animals. These peasants should lick their fingers, for this will be their last taste of such riches.
Not all of us were born into royalty, Admiral. I was raised one of these "animals."
The treasure fleet is a testament to our emperor's genius.
You know as well as I do that the emperor is a pampered old fool.
He should be more careful with his belongings. Ships vanish. Treasures never reach their destinations.
Good thing we are here to prevent such tragedies.
Every time that boy opens his mouth, I want to fill it with my fist.
I am Lao Chen. A lifetime at sea has left me stinking of fish. If it floats, I have crewed it.
Then tell me, what do you predict for our grand treasure fleet?
The fleet will sail on to glory, without question. But beware the Admiral.
I am not the only one around here who stinks.
Captain, pirate vessels prowl the waters.
Say that again, when you're picking wreckage off the seabed.
The men are tired, Admiral. They cannot work with broken backs.
They will work until the task is finished, broken backs or not.
Can we not give some of this work to the new sailors you hired?
I know they are not sailors, Admiral. It is obvious that not one of them has ever set foot on a boat.
They are mercenaries, scoundrels, and should be boiled in their own juices.
Silence. It would be wise for you to remember who commands this fleet. If you...
This is your mess, Huang. Clean it up at once!
I have already had my fill of crowded ports and foreigners. I crave conquest. I crave glory.
Some men work their whole lives to see such sights, Admiral.
True. Commoners are easily impressed. That is what separates rabble like you from men like me.
Now step aside. Royalty expects to be greeted by their own.
Jinhai may be venomous but he is not capable of betrayal.
The Zamorin wishes you welcome, Admiral. All preparations have been made.
Gulls fill the sky, the sea goddess must watch over us.
I wish I shared your faith, Chen. We have sailed west for weeks with no sign of land.
One cannot sail too far without hitting something, Captain.
It is not the sea I fear. It is the Admiral. He appears to be connected to all our misfortunes.
The Indian raiders did speak of being paid to fight...by one of our crew.
Even now, he leads our fleet off the charts into the unknown.
The Admiral has always plotted his own course.
Yes, Chen, but where is he going?
Wherever he leads us, it appears we will brave a storm before our arrival.
Like the birds, it is an omen. But a bad one.
That is the last time I pray to the sea goddess.
It is pathetic. Even at the edge of the world, men still murder each other for power.
Speaking of pathetic, have you seen the Admiral?
Our commander has vanished. I fear he was captured with the others.
Not to worry. There will always be another admiral where he came from.
Perhaps it is as you said before, and Jinhai has taken his own path. If so, he is now at the mercy of the wilderness.
Can we leave this cursed rock, then?
No. Prepare a rescue party. The hostiles captured many of our companions, and we must find them before nightfall.
I think finding them will be easier than you expect.
Not deserted. The villagers are in hiding.
I never thought you would stoop to something as common as mutiny, Jinhai.
It is not mutiny when you are the Admiral.
You hoped to plunder the riches of the fleet in India. Only you were defeated by a lowly crew of peasants and sailors.
I will not make that mistake twice.
You may not be as cowardly as I predicted, but you are much more foolish. The emperor will hear of your treachery.
In this world, I am the emperor!
Set a course for home, Chen. We sail due east.
Finally! I have been finding sand in many unwanted places.
It is a pity that a man born of such extraordinary means had to die such an ordinary death.
Decisions make a man great, Captain. Not family, not wealth.
Then I am glad you have been there to guide me, Chen.
Give me no credit. I simply follow where the bottle leads me.
Have you done as I asked?
We have scoured the beaches for all evidence of our presence.
Good. It is time the treasure fleet moved on to calmer waters: home.
Hopefully, no one will even know we were here.
Reduces the cost of all infantry.

Banner Army Loyalty Shipment has arrived.
Damages all units in the area and makes all hits critical for a short time.
This injustice must end! The British East India Company takes our treasure, displaces our rulers, and despoils our traditions.
Now it is public humiliation! I tell you, prophecy foretells the end of the Company after one century. That is now.
Be patient, you say? I have seen forty years, and not one of them free of the cursed Company.
Our only option is to work with the foreigners.
Spoken like a true coward. Like a little Englishman.
You know nothing of who I am.
Lieutenant Sahir, I have but one cardinal sin: impatience.
I am sorry, Colonel. The detainees were marched through town and stripped of their uniforms in public.
Such a fate is too good for the likes of them. Execution is the preferable method, one that makes a lasting impression.
Sir, the Company's disrespect of the people fuels an already dangerous fire.
Lieutenant, the British East India Company has ruled India for one hundred years.
I sincerely doubt that a few dyspeptic sepoy are going to change that.
If ever you need reminding of who rules this nation, simply look to the rooftops. Now, chin-up, Lieutenant.
There is a bit of sport in it, isn't there Nanib? I could be hunting fox back home in Norfolk.
If the rebels wish to disrupt our flow of saltpeter, it will take more than a few elephants to do it.
Do you see in these uprisings some common purpose?
They are not as scattered as you would believe. They will come together, and when they do, we will face an army.
Wisely spoken. You may make an effective captain, after all.
Sir! A trading post is under attack to the east.
Come, Lieutenant. Do not lose hope. Where there is tea, there is always hope.
A series of fires have broken out around Calcutta. We are directed there immediately.
How does the damned Company expect me to be everywhere at once?
Perhaps they ask too much of us all.
Bah. This is the rebels' doing. The need to stir up trouble flows in their blood.
The Company has no respect for the Indian people, Sir. That is, and always has been, the reason behind these attacks.
You forget yourself, Nanib. You are beginning to sound like one of the rebels.
If only that were something to regret, Sir.
Tread carefully, Nanib. You have been warned.
Surrender and we will spare your lives!
We will fight to the death. The British have no claim to this kingdom.
If you wish to die, then you had best find somewhere else do it. Put down your weapons. This is not how India will be won.
It will never be won while men like you wear the colors of our enemies.
Cooperation is the key to a modern India.
Cooperation is what has given this Company all of its power.
Leave this place. Leave before I forget compassion.
Well done, Lieutenant. You sent them to the slaughter. I couldn't have arranged it better myself.
The men refuse to use the new Enfield rifles, Colonel.
Then how do they expect to fight the enemy? Find out what all of the chatter is about, Lieutenant.
Colonel, there is pig fat in the rifle cartridges.
It is against the men's beliefs to eat pork in any form, so they cannot tear them open with their teeth.
I don't care what they believe. Tell them to do as I say or they will be executed.
You, Lieutenant, pick up that rifle. Show them how it's done.
Sir, it is also against my beliefs to place this cartridge in my mouth.
I am giving you an order, Lieutenant! Pick up that weapon!
Your first shot will be your last, Nanib. You have my word.
Look at how many have joined us, Nanib. We cannot fail. The war for independence has truly begun.
But we are an army without a leader.
You will be our general now, Nanib.
I never asked to be a general. I am a lieutenant in a nonexistent army, nothing more.
The cry for freedom is spreading. Bahadur Shah of the Mughal Empire has declared himself Supreme Ruler of India.
The Shah is a captive of the Company. How does he expect to lead us from deep within a prison cell?
It is simple. We will turn our rage on Delhi and free him.
If it is the will of the people, then I am at their command.
We have shown that we can defeat a regiment, but what of a whole army?
We will face that challenge when it is necessary to our goal.
And what exactly is our goal, Pravar?
We shall march on the British, and pry them from the landscape.
Perhaps, but our fight is not with the British. It is with the cursed Company.
Then we will engulf it in fire, and make them wish they'd never set foot in this country.
Yes, and I know exactly where we should start.
The Company has treated this country like property and the people like trespassers. But our liberation begins here.
Brave words, Nanib. Is this your army, a band of native thugs and villagers?
You are not firing on unarmed men this time, Colonel.
You, not I, will be leading these fools into a massacre.
No one will come. Not today. Today our fight is with you, Colonel.
We will not rest until you are dead at our feet.
You will never find me at the feet of a traitor, dead or alive.
I am impressed, Nanib. But you are simply ending one man. The Company is bigger than me.
It is bigger than you. It is bigger than this whole forsaken country.
I learned much from you, Colonel. But it is clear that you learned nothing from me.
Your Company may have the ability to set fire to a village, a home, but no company will ever set fire to a man's soul.
You cannot fight such passion. Not with money. Not with guns. Not with men.
Come, Nanib. The prophecy must be fulfilled. There are others like him to be defeated.
Yes. I am afraid there will always be others like him.

Hand cavalry that does large area damage. Good against ranged infantry and artillery.

An anti-infantry army of rifle infantry and heavy cavalry.\n5 Arquebusier: skirmisher with low hitpoints, but a long-ranged attack.\n3 Iron Flail: heavy cavalry good against ranged infantry and artillery.
The enemy preys on our supplies. Our town center must prepare another shipment of gold, and quickly.

Uesugi's army is on the march. He will receive reinforcements at each standing village. When this is done, he will make a final assault on your base.
Uesugi has shown himself at last. Swallow your fear, men. Today is a good day to die! Attack!

Bonus: +7% Land Unit Attack

Trains: Yamabushi, Ninja, Shinobi, Ronin

Shipments: Military enhancements
Come out of your isolation so that you can choose a new ally.
Daimyo Otani is dead and his men flock to us. We must not delay, and continue our march north.
Japanese assassin. Highly effective against mercenaries, Explorers, War Chiefs, and Monks.
Heals injured units. Can build Field Hospitals.
Ranged cavalry mercenary, good against cavalry
Heavily armed Japanese mercenary cavalry armed with a bow. Good against cavalry.

When this Shipment arrives, all of your current Export is exchanged for a greater amount of Coin.

Japanese leadership enables all military units to be trained more quickly. Daimyo and Shoguns train units faster than buildings. Daimyo and Shoguns move faster and have a greater line of sight.
Ships a Dojo Rickshaw, allowing you to construct a powerful Dojo to produce your choice of military units.
Seize and hold the Tokaido Road.
Defend Fushimi Castle and evacuate the villagers.

Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Defeat this guardian to collect its Treasure.
Military units can train in larger blocks.
Threshold used on Snap to Unit
Daimyo of the Fushimi Castle garrison.
It is not an admiral's place to be knee-deep in scum. Finish the fleet so I can take my rightful place at the head of the flagship.
The fleet is under attack! We must hurry and finish building the flagship before we can sail.
Captain, I have more bad news. The pirates have captured our docks to the west. Something must be done.
Thank you, Captain. The pirates are based in a village east of here. Drive them out or our work will never end.
Not only do the pirates raid our ships, but now they kidnap our laborers. We cannot finish the flagship unless every hand has work.
We should build a consulate and hire some bloodthirsty mercenaries. I can give you the names of a few good ones.
We have recaptured the docks but our stores have been emptied. They must have been moved to a safer location.
Send me to deal with this. You can check my pockets afterwards.
I am impressed, Captain. You execute pirates like a seasoned sailor.
I find no pleasure in it. Now come, we must finish the fleet and set out to sea.
Captain, the ship is coming along nicely. You must work to maintain the flow of resources.
Our men do not take their eyes from their work. If all goes as planned, the ship will be completed by nightfall.
Captain, this would be a good place to establish a trade route. We must give our workers the right materials to finish this task.
Each Village and Town Center will do a one-time muster of Pigs.
Finish the imperial flagship by completing Secondary Objectives.

Pirates have interrupted construction of the fleet by terrorizing the shipyards and kidnapping your laborers. You can only set sail by finding the proper resources to finish the fleet, and by ending the pirate threat. This is done by completing the four Secondary Objectives.
Destroy the Castle overlooking the captured Dock.
A band of pirates has descended upon your western Dock and captured it, as well as its vital supplies. You must recapture your property and destroy the Castle that guards it.
The pirates have stolen critical construction materials and transported them south to a nearby island. Use your Heroes to recover this material. Without it, the flagship will not sail.
The pirates have taken captive some of your shipbuilders. Paying ransom is out of the question. You will need to free them by using force. They are being held in stockades to the east.
Destroy the pirate lair and end the threat to your fleet.
The pirate village lies to the east. To end the constant attacks on your ships and laborers, you will need to find and destroy this threat.
Leader among the Knights of St. John on Malta.
Locate the lost Treasure Ships and any survivors.
Find and secure your beached Treasure Ships.
The recent storm has beached three of your Treasure Ships along the coastline of this mysterious country. You must hurry and secure them, saving any surviving crew from the dangers of the wilderness.

You may have accidentally invaded their territory, but you cannot establish a settlement in this land without dealing with its locals. The hostile natives strike you at every turn. Eliminate this threat at its source: The native's village Temple.
Build a Town Center and a Dock.

An unexpected betrayal by the Zamorin of Kozhikode has left your ships damaged, and your fleet leaderless. You must build a Dock in order to build ships. Only then will you be able to rescue the Admiral and take your revenge.
Jinhai is most likely been held captive in the Zamorin's stronghold. You must build a strong enough army to invade the mainland and save your superior officer.
It is time for vengeance! The Middle Kingdom will not accept such treachery. Destroy the Zamorin Town Center to the east, and send a clear message.
Build a Castle on the beach.
To secure your position on the enemy beach you will need to build a Castle. This will enable you to train artillery and resist the tide of enemy warriors.

Trains and upgrades infantry units as well as defends an area with a ranged attack.

Stop the prisoner convoy before it reaches its destination.

The hostiles are attempting to transport their prisoners. You must vanquish the convoy and rescue your men before they reach the enemy settlement. Try using Captain Huang's explosive new ability to blast a path through the trees and get a drop on the convoy.
Find and free your captured shipmates.
The treasure fleet does not leave anyone behind. Use every method at your disposal to carve a path through the jungle and free your scattered sailors.
An explosive attack that only damages trees.
A grove of mango trees that can be harvested for Wood.
Transforms into a Mango Grove for Wood production.
Move to the northern beaches and recover your crew.
Use the caves to move through the region and avoid the mutineer patrols. Sneak around the Aztec settlement and rejoin your shipmates.
Fight your way past the defenses and into the Aztec city. Then destroy the Town Centers that Jinhai and his mutineers have constructed as the heart of their new empire.
Dig through the cave wall to reach the Mines.
Use your villagers to excavate the cave wall and gain entrance to the Gold Mines. There may be another reason for exploring these caverns, one you did not expect to find.

string.comment: objective: build a town center and a dock

language.string: By betraying us, the Zamorin has sealed his fate. Prepare the ships for a raid on the northern beach. Vengeance will be ours.
We must hurry! All this time on land is making me seasick.
There is little time. Who knows what the Zamorin is doing to the Admiral. Now is the time to launch a rescue.

string.comment: there are zamorins on the island

language.string: We are not alone on this island, Captain. It is a good thing. I was becoming bored with all of this peace and quiet.
The only way to hold this beach is to build a castle. Hurry, before the whole mainland is alerted to our presence.
This is strange. There are Chinese among the enemy dead. It seems that some of our crew chose to fight with the raiders.
This news does not sit well in my stomach. Come. Smoke rises in the east. Where there is smoke, there are devils.
I'm surprised to see you, Huang. I did not believe you had the intelligence to mount a successful rescue.
Now finish this little escapade so the fleet can sail on. I will leave the Zamorin to you.
That will teach the Zamorin to take what does not belong to him.
Let us get back out to sea before our good fortune turns.
I have spotted our captured companions, but the enemy are too many.
This is not the time for cowardice. Our companions depend on us to rescue them before they reach the hostiles' camp.
The forest is too thick. We will never reach the convoy in time to attack.
Put some of the fleet's explosives to good use. Try taking down some of these trees with a bang.
Ships a Rice Paddy Rickshaw and increases Villagers' gather rate from Rice Paddies, Mills, Farms, and Estates for Food and Coin.
Ships a Rice Paddy Rickshaw and increases Villagers' gather rate from Rice Paddies, Mills, Farms, and Estates for Food and Coin.
Captain, another tribe of natives lives in these lands. Perhaps we should gain their trust, become allies.
Ships a Rice Paddy Rickshaw and increased villagers' gather rate from Rice Paddies, Mills, Farms, and Estates for Food and Coin, +1 Villager.
The sun falls in the west, we must move faster. Every second lost could mean the life of one of our shipmates.
The convoy is on the move. Pick up your feet, men. Lives are at stake!
The convoy has been defeated, but our work is not yet done. There will be no rest while the enemy holds our friends.
We should find another entrance into their village, one that is less...painful.
The village is under our control and the hostiles have disbanded, but I still see no sign of the admiral.
Daimyo, trains troops and receives shipments
Extremely powerful Japanese lord who can train troops and receive Shipments.
A powerful Castle that provides an excellent defense.
Those gates are too strong. We should stay in the jungle, where the shadows hide our movements.
We cannot help our friends while lying dead at the foot of these gates. Find another way.
There is the prisoner convoy! Attack! Free our friends!
Interesting. I did not expect that to actually work.
Captain, your crew is scattered all over this jungle. You must hurry. Our friends face a grim fate at the hands of these natives.
Thank you, Captain. Let us join you. These hostiles are fierce, you will need our help.
Configure the Treasure Ship to produce Food crates.
The Treasure Ship is producing Food crates.
Configure the Treasure Ship to produce Wood crates.
The Treasure Ship is producing Wood crates.
Configure the Treasure Ship to produce Coin crates.
The Treasure Ship is producing Coin crates.
Kick out your ally so that you can choose a new one.
Fall back into the caves. We will not last long against these betrayers.
I said it from the beginning. That traitorous admiral gives sailors a bad name.
We will move undetected through these caves. Once we reach the northern beaches, we can begin to rebuild our army.
Proceed carefully. If we are spotted, we will have to fight our way to freedom.
Jinhai uses the native village as his own. Keep moving across the valley. We are too few to fight.
Up ahead. Sunlight. We've reached the cave's end at last.
I have never been happier to smell the stink of the sea.
How odd. This cave opens directly into the enemy stronghold, and it gives me a dastardly idea.
Go back to your village, Captain Huang. You do not have the spine to do what needs to be done.
You do not belong in this strange land, Captain Huang. The longer you stay, the more innocent blood will stain your hands.
No one will mourn you, Captain Huang. You will die a peasant's death on this lost rock.
You think you have defeated me, but you are mistaken. This is only the beginning of my reign.
In the next life, perhaps, but not in this one.
I relieve you of your command, Admiral.
Captain, I noticed glints of gold as we escaped through the caverns. We should investigate.
We should be safe in the shadows, but only if we keep moving.
Trees from below the snowline, such as hemlock and spruce. Harvest for Wood.
Robust Mongolian trees such as fir and the saxual. Harvest for Wood.

We are training too many soldiers. Build a village to house our growing numbers.
Let us build a great wonder in honor of the Emperor. It will raise morale and strengthen our army.
Otherwise, we will not stand a chance, and our dead will litter the beaches.

Artillery will auto limber if told to move large distances
All my life, I have had the same dream. A beach. Palms in the morning light. Waves on the sand.
I do not know this place, or where to find it, only that my destiny waits beyond the tide.
Standard Army Reforms Shipment has arrived.
Ming Army Hitpoints Shipment has arrived.
Qiang Pikeman, Changdao, Keshik, and Meteor Hammer attack and hitpoints increased.
Ming Army Hitpoints Shipment has arrived.
Chu Ko Nu and Arquebusier attack increased and do extra damage to light cavalry and heavy infantry.
Territorial Army Advanced Combat Shipment has arrived.
Han Anti-Cavalry Attack Shipment has arrived.
Old Han Anti-Heavy Infantry Attack Shipment has arrived.
A beachy mix of palms in the sand. Harvest for Wood.
Captain, it is you. We worried you had forgotten about us.
Greetings, Captain. It is good to see you again.
Many thanks, Captain. We could not have survived long without you.
We are at your command, Captain.
It has been too long since we received news from the Admiral. I am growing worried.
You should be worried about us, Captain. Those approaching warriors have murder in their eyes.
Run, Chen! We have been betrayed. Our only hope is to escape with the ships.

At last! After many years of selfless service, I have finally been given the rank of captain. I am to command one of the ships in the Emperor's grand treasure fleet, an undertaking like none other. The glories of the Middle Kingdom will touch every shore.

We prepare to sail with more than 300 ships, and a crew of nearly 20,000. However, my good fortune has come at a price. I must serve under the Emperor's nephew, Admiral Jinhai, a notoriously spoiled child of a man.

The fleet stops in the port city of Calicut, realm of the Zamorin of Kozhikode. The crew's hatred of the Admiral has reached a fevered pitch. My own patience would be strained if not for Chen, a strange old barnacle that has fastened himself to my side.

Familiar waters are far behind us. We sail forever west, long after our companions have turned back. It appears that our fates are linked to the whims of a madman, a child with delusions of grandeur. Yet, what choice do I have? I serve the Emperor.

Never did I expect to discover an undiscovered wilderness. How many hours of my youth did I spend gazing over the Jinhsa Jiang, hoping to see a destiny such as this in the rushing waters? But there is no time left for dreams. The lives of my crew depend on me.

I miss my home, the sight of the rain falling over the mountains, the peace of an evening's rest. I worry about the Admiral. Perhaps I misjudged him, for he is only a boy. At this moment he may be cowering in the jungle, wishing only to glimpse a friendly face.
TEAM Houses and Longhouses have more hitpoints and support more population. VIllages, Shrines, and Manors have somewhat more hitpoints and support more population.

This strange land is on no map I know.
Where we are is a mystery for another time. The fleet has been scattered along the coast. We must locate our ships and any surviving crew.
Natives, and hostile ones! They act as though we wanted to crash upon this cursed rock.
Captain, we are here! Help us!
Thank the Goddess, you've come! Beware of the natives, for they are fierce!
Hurry, Captain. We cannot hold out much longer against these hostiles.
I have had enough. Strangers or not, we have done nothing to these hostiles.
We are going to finish this little war before it truly begins.
Let us hope there are no more of them. I doubt we could handle one more heated battle like that one.
Captain, why is it that whenever we're together I find myself facing the tip of a sword?

Nepalese skirmisher that is accurate to a long range. Good against infantry.

All Native Lore improvements at Trading Posts cost less.
Native American Lore Shipment has arrived.
All Native Lore improvements at Trading Posts cost less, +1 Villager.
TEAM Better Housing Shipment has arrived.
TEAM Better Housing Shipment has arrived.
All units get increased attack and hitpoints.
The natives of this region wish to rise up and claimed our saltpeter sites, which we require for gunpowder. We must act, and act now.
That is all. The men are yours, Lieutenant.
We will not let the enemy have one handful of saltpeter, Sir. You have my word.
Establish a headquarters here. And hurry. The natives are eager to win back their homeland.
The natives rush to seize the Company's saltpeter route. We must stop their progress by destroying the trading posts.
This is no time for celebration, Lieutenant. There are two other trading posts that require your attention. Now get on with it!
The Sikhs have compromised our interests here. We must claim the sites to the east to reinvigorate the flow of saltpeter.
You should establish a field for grazing animals. I've seen such spaces work wonders for the natives in this region.
The Sikh stockades overflow with those too smart to participate in this insurrection. Free them, and put them to work.
Wonderful. Our interests in the Punjab have been maintained. You may make something of yourself after all, Lieutenant.
Just our luck, natives have settled on my saltpeter sites. No matter. Relocate them, Lieutenant.
Don't let these elephants startle you, Nanib. Aim for the eyes.
Our men are with you, Lieutenant Nanib, but our meager force is no match for the Company vanguard.
Then we must proceed carefully and avoid the patrols until we can find a way into the city. We must free the Shah.
A sudden noise might spook those elephants. If we are lucky, they will be our battering rams.
The freedom fighters have come. We are with you, Lieutenant!
Do you hear something? A rumble?
Look for more elephants. By harnessing their strength, we can break any wall that stands in our way.
You have freed us, stranger. We will repay you with our lives. Tell us what to do.
Many of the sepoys are siding with us. The more men we find or free, the stronger our rebellion will become.
The only way through that wall is to have an elephant knock it down for us. After that, we will march right in.
Shoot it! Shoot it! It's headed right for the gates!
This is a city, not a circus! Move more troops into the streets, and end this uprising.
India will be ruled by Indians!
We must act now, while the guards try to subdue that rampaging elephant. Free the Shah and set fire to the stockades.
Fighting between sepoys and the British has broken out inside the fort. We must get through the gates and turn the tide.
The Shah is free, and the citizens of Delhi are rising up against their oppressors.
Like the cowards that they are, the Company vanguard has retreated to the opposite side of the river. We must destroy them before they can regroup.
We must escort the Shah to greet his subjects. When the people see him, they will rise up with us, and fight.
The Shah is free, just as they said. Take back Delhi! Take back India!
The Company brings in ships to reinforce from the sea. We have to stop this before we are overrun.
The Company has weapons scattered across the city. If we wish to uproot the tree, we must dig up every poisonous root.
Let us see the Company shoot us without bullets, slay without swords.
Delhi is ours. This day will be remembered, for this is the day we set our nation free.
Ships 1 Mansabdar Urumi Swordsman and 9 Urumi Swordsmen, +1 Villager.
Ships 1 Mansabdar Sowar and 8 Sowars, +1 Villager.
Ships 1 Mansabdar Howdah and 1 Howdah, +1 Villager.

Flaming Arrow Cost Shipment has arrived.
Flaming Arrow Hitpoints Shipment has arrived.
Morutaru attack, range, and line of sight increased.
Trains healers and provides town improvements and unique improvements.
Transforms into a Factory for economic and heavy artillery production.
Transforms into a Church for town improvements and unique improvements.
Use your Covered Wagon to build a Town Center. Find a suitable location with plenty of accessible resources.
Build Trading Posts on the Trade Route.
Build Trading Posts on the natives' Trade Route and claim the region for the British East India Company.
Build Trading Posts on the saltpeter sites.
Saltpeter is a lucrative commodity, and essential to the survival of the British East India Company. All areas rich in saltpeter must be acquired, no matter what the cost.
The Indians gain extra XP for herdables that are tasked on their Sacred Fields. Build a Sacred Field and send any herdables you discover to get an experience point boost.
Transforms into a Monastery for training repentant mercenaries or researching unique Monk technologies.
Move east to the Company Town Center.
Move your small force east to safety in the Company-controlled village.
Destroy the 8 Barracks of the resistance fighters.
A large band of Arsonists are striking from Barracks located in the countryside. Every one of these resistance centers must be located and then destroyed.
I will live again, if only as a butterfly.
My last thoughts are of compassion...and unbearable pain.
Defeat all of the Company soldiers in the town.
The Sepoys are rebelling! Drive the Company soldiers from the village and claim it for the headquarters of your resistance.
The Company's Arsenals are full of weapons that need to be destroyed if the British East India Company is to be defeated. Try a charge on the front gates, or find another way in.
Fight your way into the eastern Mines.
The eastern Mines will provide you with an alternate method of striking at the Company's Arsenal.
Destroy the Weapon Caches in the mine.
The Weapon Caches are connected to the Arsenals that lie above. Destroying them will cause a chain reaction that will bring the entire Fort crashing down around the British.
Destroy the Trading Posts on the saltpeter sites.
Edwardson's army needs to be drawn out and destroyed. Build up experience points by destroying Trading Posts and other Company buildings. When you earn enough XP, Edwardson will come after you.
Prepare your defenses and destroy Edwardson's incoming army.
Edwardson is sending out his army, and it is up to you to defend against his waves of troops. Each wave will feature different enemy units, so try to counter them with the best defenders.
Now that the Fort has been emptied of its wealth of defenders, it is time to strike. Fight through the multiple keeps to reach the Command Post in the Fort's heart.
One of the Fort's most powerful defenses is the pair of Fixed Guns mounted behind the eastern and western walls. If you capture these enormous weapons, you will be able to use them to your advantage.
Clear the Company's vital Trade Route.
Destroying Edwardson's Trading Posts will shatter his Trade Route and cut him off from his allies. When this is done, you can build your own Trade Route to gain additional resources.
Destroy the Company Docks in the northeast.
The Company keeps an active navy at its Docks in the northeast. Destroy the Docks before Edwardson sends his navy against you.
Not all of the Sepoys have rebelled. They need to be defeated along with the Company.
The British East India is storing plundered materials in a warehouse to the west.
Send a Coin Wagon to the Russian Church.
Use a Coin Wagon to buy the services of the Russians.
Yellow River: A wet-dry region similar to the Yellow River, but on a much grander scale.
Turn on to show the Wonder power UI.

He was just a boy from Nagwa. It is said that before killing his commanding officer, he declared it was his Dharma to resist the British. He was a sepoy, like me. He worked for the Company, like me. He was also a hero, but I'm not a hero. It would do me good to stop listening to rumors.

The Company sends us to protect our interests in the Punjab. I feel the bitter gazes of the sepoys upon me, but collaboration is the only way to keep the peace. Today that sepoy who killed his commander was hanged. Heroes never live for long.

Once again, we emerge from battle victorious. The Company proves time and again that it is unstoppable. It does not give me confidence. On the contrary, every time I lift my sword I do not know whom to strike: my people, or my employer.

How much blood can stain one man's hands? There is nowhere to run as long as I wear this red coat. I am beginning to understand what that boy who was executed must have felt. When you have nowhere to run, you must create a new path.

It is a new morning. Men and women stream into the streets to join us, and every face is a joyous one. Is this what I have been fighting, what I have been hoping to stamp down into the dirt? No more. Today, I lead a new army - an Indian army.

Delhi has fallen, but the fires still burn, and they will keep burning. My brothers and I make for Shimla to lay our cause at the feet of Colonel Edwardson himself. I no longer fear the inevitable end, for the path leading me there is my own.

One minute until end of Cease Fire!

Invade the mainland and rescue Admiral Jinhai
Yojimbo can be trained from the Monastery, and outlaw-type units cost less pop.
A pet monkey that likes to wash his food and is good against guardians.
Outlaw-type units cost less population. Train Repentant Yojimbo mercenaries at the monastery once you reach the Fortress Age.
Outlaw-type units cost less population. Train Repentant Iron Troops mercenaries at the monastery once you reach the Fortress Age.

A powerful blast that heavily damages a single-target building.
Ambush the prisoner convoy and rescue your crew.
Find the fleet and then defeat the mutinous Jinhai
Rebels have plagued the Company around Calcutta. They have holed up in the villages like rats in a wall.
Find them, and teach them that strikes against the Company will not go unpunished.
We are under attack! The audacity of these vermin!
That will teach them to defy the Company!
You can take my last breath, but you will never take my country.
Good show, Nanib! Burn that bloody village to the ground.
We may fall, but others will fight on.
Take that, you fools! This is good shooting.
Visit the consulate. We will use established methods from the Empire to counter our enemy's trickery.
We have quelled the rebellion. But at what price?
These are dangerous lands. March east to the village across the river. The Company will direct us from there.
We have reached the safety of the village just in time.
Look at these villagers. My own people gaze on me with such distrust. I will never get used to it.
Units and Buildings give more bonus xp
That does not mean they will stop trying.
Kill the garrison commander before he can call for reinforcements!
We have defeated the Company garrison and seized the town. I never thought a victory was possible.
Our rebellion will not last long if we confront the Company fort directly. We must destroy its arsenals to disarm its men.
Fall back! Retreat! The gates are too well guarded.
Edwardson hopes to outlast us. He hides behind his walls and artillery.
Edwardson hopes to outlast us. He hides behind his walls and artillery.
He thinks reinforcements will come, but he is mistaken.
The Company still moves freely. Destroy the docks and make Edwardson's fort an island.
We need supplies desperately. Send men to raid the Company's stores to the west. Take back what is rightfully ours.
If we cannot reach Edwardson's heart, then we will cut away at his limbs. Attacking his trading posts will leave him helpless.
Edwardson mistakes cowardice for patience. We must do more than we anticipated to force his hand.
That does it! He is coming out! Prepare yourselves, men. This is no time for weakness.
Enemy soldiers charge our headquarters. The Company is as ruthless as ever.
Not even his precious Company could help Edwardson in the end. I fear this battle is the beginning of a long and costly war.
I will take that as a compliment.
Our private war has only just begun, Nanib. We will finish this on my terms.
Is that you, Nanib? Your men buzz around me like flies on a bull. I hardly feel a thing.
I have had enough of these annoyances, Nanib. I am going to reach out and smash you like an insect.
Did you honestly believe you could challenge the Company, Nanib? Must I remind you that we execute traitors?
I will accept your defeat any time you are ready. There is no hurry, however. I am thoroughly enjoying this.
Don't slink away now, Nanib. That was only a mere fraction of my forces.
You drive your men to suicide. They die for nothing.
How many of you must I kill before you realize the futility of your actions?
No. I will not die at the feet of a traitor.
Look! Other sepoys have joined us! Fight, brothers, fight for your freedom!
Listen, Nanib. The Company has a mining operation to the east, with access to the fort.
Instead of marching through the front, we will slip in through the back.
Look! The Company thought its gunpowder would be safe underground. One spark and the whole fort will go up in flames.
It worked, the fire is spreading.
We have taught the Company a grave lesson today. One it will not soon forget.
If all goes as planned, that fort will become his tomb.
These soldiers fight with our enemy. The time for negotiations has passed. Death to collaborators!
Colonel Edwardson's doom is a foregone conclusion. Send us a wagon of gold, and we will help you throw the Company into the sea.
I foresee a long and fruitful relationship between your people and mine, Lieutenant.
We fight with you, Nanib! It is time for the Company to take our orders!
A flying kick that can be used to disable guardians or enemy military units.
An explosive attack that does heavy damage to buildings and ships.
We cannot let the rebels gain the upper hand. Protect the Company establishment at all costs.
The rebels see the Company's local headquarters as a symbol of British tyranny, and they will stop at nothing to burn it to the ground. You must not let this happen.
Destroy the native Trade Route and secure the region's saltpeter.
Protect the Company's Command Post and destroy the resistance.
Resist your oppressors, and then fight to sabotage their Arsenal.
Rescue the Shah and lead him to freedom.
End Edwardson's reign of terror by destroying his Command Post.
Our headquarters is under attack! Fight on! We can never give up!

Officer of the British East India Company.
That does not mean they will stop trying.
"This is not our war, but if you build a Trading Post here perhaps we can work together."
Outlaw-type units (Wildwest, Wokou, Maratha, etc) are recruited much faster and gain more attack and hitpoints.
The Chinese are mighty and should be respected.
My heart trembles. When the Chinese army marches, every heart trembles.
The Japanese are mighty and should be respected.
Never have I seen a people as graceful at killing as the Japanese. Tread cautiously.
The traitorous Indians are mighty and should be respected.
I know my own people, and they will never stop fighting until they have reached their objective.
Destroy the Weapon Caches to cause an elephant stampede.
Attacking the Weapon Caches will cause an impressive explosion, and most likely spook the nearby elephants. The walls of Delhi cannot stand up against the force of a rampaging herd.
Raze the Agra Fort Wonder to free the Shah.
The Shah is being held captive by the Company. Destroy the Agra Fort overlooking the Shah's prison yard and you will win his freedom.
Safely escort the Shah out of the city.
Move the Shah through the city and help him to escape. You must protect him. If he falls in combat, your mission has failed.
Free imprisoned Sepoys from the Stockades.

The Sepoys of Delhi have risen up against their Company commanders. As a result, they have been thrown into prison and are awaiting execution. Rescue these soldiers to make your army a force to be reckoned with.
Inspire the citizens of Delhi by moving the Shah to each flagged area.
Bring the Shah to the flagged areas to inspire the citizens of the city and convince them to join your army. This is the only way to receive reinforcements.
Upgrades this Trade Route to use Trade Carts, which can deliver resources, move faster, and provide greater line of sight.
Upgrades this Trade Route to use Trains, which deliver resources faster and provide greater line of sight.
To reach Edwardson we will need to cease the fire of his great cannon. Focus your attacks on the eastern and western walls.
The mills in the west are Edwardson's most precious resource. If we burn them down, he will starve behind the safety of his walls.
So, the traitors have rediscovered their hearts and returned to their people.
Your people and ours will fight side by side. Use our fire to leave the enemy in ruins.

Without the Company's saltpeter sites, Edwardson will be powerless. March west and destroy them.
Locate native resistance fighters and gain their support.
The Company has established a strong presence in the area. Allying with local resistance fighters would enhance your military. Their skill at laying siege are known throughout the land.
Destroy the Company's Mills in the western town.
The soldiers of Edwardson's garrison are supplied by the Mills and Farms to the west. A sure way to get the enemy's attention would be to destroy these resources and cut off the flow of Food.

Silk Road: Travel the legendary trade route, capturing existing Trading Posts. You begin with a free Market.

Settlements: Bhakti, Shaolin, Sufi, Udasi, Zen
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Catamaran, Wokou Horesman, Wokou Monk

Starting from their Markets at opposite sections of the famed Silk Road, players vie for control of this lucrative Trade Route. Since the map portrays a randomly selected part of the passage, three terrain variations are possible, each with unique characteristics. Players do not need to establish the route, only capture it before the enemy does!

This means that some parts of the game, including features (like chat and multiplayer), might not function as expected (or might not function at all). The game might even crash. Because this is a pre-release game, Microsoft and the developer do not commit to providing customer support for the game.

Shaken by the bloodshed, Chayton seeks to reunite with his Uncle, an elder of the Lakȟóta.
With the Falcon Company's railroad upgrade completed, Chayton returned East; yet it was only a matter of time until his return...
The threat to the gold mines is finally under control, but what about the threat to the Lakȟóta?
The trail to Uncle Frank was tough, but how will the Lakȟóta elder take the news?
Holme has vanished. Chayton’s only hope to stop this impending war is to find his former friend and resolve this once and for all.

To learn from the power of our own stories is uniquely human. At World’s Edge, we value authenticity and respectful representations grounded in truth. The original release of Age of Empires III took liberties with the depiction of Indigenous civilizations, as well as the depiction of events and personages from American history. As we developed the Age of Empires III: Definitive Edition, we collaborated with Native American and First Nations consultants to correct these errors. We are immensely grateful for the time, patience, and faith shown to us by the members of the Lakota and Haudenosaunee Nations. We have replaced inaccurate or stereotypical depictions, created new voiceover using authentic speakers, and addressed problematic and harmful mechanics and storylines. We hope that you, the Age III DE player, will join us in celebrating the rich and vibrant cultures represented in the game. We have increased our resolve going forward to live out the values of "Gaming for Everyone" – a commitment to a journey, not a destination.

Food is used to train units and research technologies. You start the game with a few resource crates containing food–which your Villagers can collect.
This early food is used to train additional Villagers from the Town Center. It is important to always keep training new Villagers in order to improve your economy.
Herds of huntable animals roam the map. They are a fast source of food, but hunting them may expose your Villagers to danger.

These herds will run away from hunters. Use this to your advantage! If the hunters attack the animals in the direction of your settlement, the herd will run closer to your Town Center, where you can gather from it safely and newly trained Settlers will not have to walk so far.
Once you have trained enough Villagers and have 800 food, advance to the Commerce Age at your Town Center. Advancing to new ages will unlock new units, buildings, and technologies.
Before we explore what the Commerce Age has in store for us, let us see how well you can manage your early economy.

Another way to obtain resources early in the game is to have your Explorer collect various treasures found in the New World. Treasures usually yield resources, but may sometimes grant you a unit or bonus instead. Your Explorer and your Settlers are able to collect treasures.

Small treasures can be found near your starting position, but you will need to venture outside of your town to find larger rewards. The Explorer is excellent at scouting the map and providing you with information about the surrounding area.

Most treasures are guarded and can only be collected once their guardians are defeated. The Explorer, with his higher hitpoints, attack, and special attack ability, is better than Settlers at fighting guardians.

Some guardians are too strong for even the Explorer to fight early on. As you advance through the ages, your Explorer becomes stronger and you can train military units to assist him in fighting guardians.

You will have to judge which treasures are worth taking, weighing the rewards with the danger posed by the guardians. Your enemies will also try to collect all of the treasures. You should prioritize the treasures that will bolster your early economy. Let us see how well you can manage this.

Your town is just that–a town. You are on a mission from your homeland. Therefore, your home city will supply you to help you complete your mission. Anything you do–constructing buildings, training units, and destroying enemy assets–generates experience that can be exchanged for this help.
Once you have accumulated enough experience, you will earn a shipment. These shipments can be used to deliver units, ships, resource crates, building wagons, and even unit improvements!

Normally, the shipped units are delivered to your Town Center, but other buildings, such as Outposts or Forts, can be set to receive shipments. Naval shipments arrive at a separate flag located on the water.

A good way to generate experience is to have your Explorer construct a Trading Post on a trade route. Whenever the trade caravan passes your Trading Post, you will receive a large amount of experience. In later ages, the Trading Post can also generate other resources.
Do not forget to be active if you want to earn experience! Your home city will reward you not only for exploring the New World, but also for keeping others away from it.

A well-maintained economy is required to advance your town through the ages. The more Settlers you have, the stronger your economy. It is therefore important to keep training Settlers throughout the game.

A common strategy, known as 'booming', focuses on building a gigantic economy and largely ignoring military. The point of booming is to be able to afford large armies to crush your enemies later in the game.

When booming, you may find that natural resources like huntable animals and coin mines quickly become scarce. You will also have to rely on economic buildings such as Mills. Settlers gather resources from these infinitely, but very slowly.

In the later ages, you will be able to construct additional Town Centers. This will allow you to train more Settlers and grow your economy faster. Advancing to later ages is expensive, so you will need many Settlers if you want an advantage over your enemy.
Certain strategies are more effective than others. A key component of a successful strategy is the build order.
Much like a baker follows a recipe to produce hearty German pumpernickel, diligently following a build order will give you a strong economic foundation for your field tactics.
A good build order guides your building construction and unit training, as well as the distribution of Settlers. Build orders vary among civilizations based on their unique strengths and weaknesses.

For this lesson, we will guide you through a build order to get your town off to a quick start. You will play as the French, a civilization that can use some powerful strategies in the mid-Commerce Age, owing to their special Coureur des Bois unit. This type of Settler is stronger and better at gathering resources than other Settlers, but costs more. Use these special French Settlers to quickly gather and advance.

Just as there are strategies for growing your town's economy, there are also military strategies. First, we must focus on defense. Your enemies may attack you to attempt to cripple your economy. You must learn how to react and defend against such attacks.

Your main method of defense is garrisoning your Settlers inside any nearby Town Centers or Outposts. This will allow your Settlers to fire upon enemy soldiers. Your Town Center can also be used to call on Minutemen, soldiers whose high attack make them an excellent choice for repulsing enemy attacks. Just know that Minutemen lose hitpoints over time, making them poor offensive units.

Attacking a town and destroying buildings will take a lot of time for a player without siege equipment. If you have military buildings of your own, take the enemy’s slow advance as an opportunity to train some soldiers of your own. Alternatively, if you have earned a shipment, you can call up some troops from your home city.
Let us see if you are up to the task of defending your town against invaders.

Rushing–attacking the enemy early–is another common strategy. A small investment in military will pay off if you can cripple your enemy’s economy and gain an advantage. War is economics by other means, after all. Cavalry and ranged units are best suited to rushing due to their mobility and range.

Settlers and Villagers require some effort to kill. It would be wise to move your units as close to them as possible and attack them before the enemy notices your presence. That way, you can maximize your damage, even as they try to run.

Dealing damage with melee attacks will cause fleeing enemies to be slowed for a few seconds. This is called "snaring", and makes it harder for the opponent to escape a dangerous situation–which in turn often guarantees kills for the snaring player.

Beware of enemy defenses! The longer that your raiders stay alive, the more you will be able to harass and disrupt your enemy’s economy. If you do not think that you can face the defenders, it is better to run and fight another day…or seek out more undefended Settlers.

The choice of units for your army is very important. Units differ from one another in significant ways. Most importantly, certain unit types deal bonus damage against other unit types, allowing them to act as a counter.
A common example is the balance between heavy infantry, heavy cavalry, and ranged infantry.
Ranged infantry counter heavy infantry...and so forth.

A balanced army requires more than one unit type. By diversifying your army, you can make full use of each unit’s strengths and eliminate their weaknesses through cooperation. Now, it is time to see for yourself which units are best used against others. Perhaps you can one day even match the Duke of Wellington himself!

When foraying into new territory, mastering the sea can be as important as dominating the land. Oceans and lakes hold sources of both food and coin, and can be used to transport your troops behind enemy fortifications. To control the water, it is important to remember which ships you have at your disposal.

Warships come in many sizes, from the small exploration vessels, such as the Caravel, to larger combat ships, such as the Galleon, Frigate, and Monitor. The larger a ship is, the better it will perform in battle. Some ships have the ability to launch a devastating broadside volley, while others can train new soldiers.
Defensive buildings and artillery are able to combat ships very effectively. Make sure not to sail too close to these fortifications!
Like Admiral Nelson at Trafalgar, mastering the waves will give you victory. Now, you must manage your ships and see how they fare in battle.

Artillery is one of the most powerful weapons of this era. Cannons are mainly adept at demolishing large groups of infantry and buildings. However, they take time to reload and are very vulnerable to melee attacks.

Artillery pieces must unlimber before they can fire. While in firing mode, their movement slows to a crawl. However, you can overcome this weakness by preparing them before a conflict. Once a battle is over, task your cannons to limber again so that they can move around more easily.

Like other units, each type of artillery plays a different role. The Falconet specializes in attacking infantry, the lighter Culverin is best used against other artillery, and the extremely heavy Mortar excels at demolishing buildings from a safe distance.
Mastering the use of artillery will let you dominate the battlefield as Napoleon did. Now, let us see if you can support your allies with your newfound knowledge of cannons.
The Russian army is on its last legs. Finish it off!
Allied Ottoman Galleys are attacking the Russian fort by sea. Command your army to attack it by land!
Take these Great Bombards. They will turn the Russian fortifications into mere stacks of firewood!
Ottoman reinforcements have landed inside of the enemy fort. Now is the moment to push forward!
You can use the Russian production buildings to train more units and research valuable technologies to improve your soldiers.
The next target is the Aztec base to the east. Strike while the iron is hot!
Do not forget about home city shipments–you can use the extra soldiers for your offensive. Land shipments can spawn at any Outpost or Fort that you control. Naval shipments will arrive on the lake.
Now that the Aztecs have submitted, we must target the Japanese to the north!

Janissaries, the core of the Ottoman army, can be trained at the camp to the east. We should not forget to use our shipments to bring in more soldiers from the Empire. You can change the shipment arrival point by clicking on the Outpost and pressing the button.
Fresh troops have arrived from the east!
The Japanese control a harbor. We should use our Galleys to destroy their ships!
The Japanese have surrendered their shipyards to us. Forward! On to the British camp!
Reinforcements from the Empire have arrived to the northeast.
The British are no more and only one enemy remains. The French have a strong fortress, but with the help of our cannons and warships, we will obliterate it!
Another of our regiments has arrived from the north. With its help, we can siege the French fortress!
Our last enemy has surrendered. The region is ours–well done, Commander!
Age of Empires III: Definitive Edition - Demo Scenario
Use shrewd tactics to destroy the enemy forces. For example, send your cavalry behind the enemy lines and attack their cannons from the rear.
Defeat the Russians by destroying their Blockhouses.
The strength of the Russians lies in their massed infantry. Use your cannons to negate their overwhelming numbers.
Defeat the Aztecs by destroying their War Huts.
The Aztecs cannot access cavalry or artillery, but you should not underestimate their army. Their infantry units are versatile and strong.
Defeat the Japanese by destroying their Castles.
The Japanese have many strong unique units. Their Samurai and Ashigaru Musketeers are particularly fearsome.
Defeat the British by destroying their Fort.
The British have the famed Redcoats at their disposal. Dealing with these experienced soldiers will be no easy feat.
Defeat the French by destroying their Fort Headquarters.
The French have built a strong fort on the hill and protect it with an elite force. Beware their Cuirassier cavalry, whose prowess is unmatched.
Build a Trading Post on each of the Trade Route sockets.
Use your Explorer to build a Trading Post near every enemy base that you conquer.
Time left to earn the gold medal
Time left to earn the silver medal
Time left to earn the bronze medal
Use your Home City to ship in units to counter the enemy attacks.
Your objective in this challenge is simple: train 12 Villagers and gather enough food to advance to the next age.
The key to a successful early economy is to ensure that all of your Villagers are working at all times and that your Town Center does not stop producing Villagers.
After your Villagers have emptied the crates, have them hunt the nearby animals and begin training new Villagers at the Town Center.
The enemy has built Outposts near our herds to deter you from gathering food. Drive the animals towards your Town Center to keep your Villagers out of the Outposts' range.
To drive a herd to your Town Center, send a Villager behind the nearby herd and fire on one of the animals. If done properly, the herd will move closer to your Town Center.
Well done! You now have enough food.
Excellent. You have trained enough Villagers.
Good job. Now, click the button to advance to the next age at your Town Center.
You can still earn a silver medal if you hurry.
If you hurry, you can still earn a bronze medal.
Unfortunately, you have not been fast enough! You can still finish the mission, but you must try again to achieve a better time and earn a medal.
Well done! You have set up your town economy for the next age.
Use your War Chief to explore the area and find nearby herds of animals.
Remember to drive herds towards your Town Center! Avoid pushing the animals towards your enemy.
Learn how to manage your economy during the early game.
Keep your Town Center producing Villagers at all times.
Send a Villager behind a herd and fire on one animal to drive the herd closer to your Town Center. If you do not drive the herd home, your Villagers will be vulnerable to the enemy Outposts!
Click the button to advance to the Commerce Age.
Select your Town Center and click on the Advance to the Commerce Age button. Then, select a Politician to complete the challenge.
Early on, it is important to collect Treasures that will speed the growth of your early economy. These Treasures are protected by Guardians that you will need to kill before collecting the reward.
The closest Treasure to your Town Center is protected by a wolf–one of the weaker Guardians. Kill it and collect the Treasure.
Good job! Now, scout the map with your Explorer and claim those Treasures that you deem important for this challenge.

Ottoman Settlers train automatically, so you must merely put them to work whenever they are created. Do not forget to build Houses, though. If you do not have enough population space, you will no longer produce Settlers.
Avoid Treasures with strong Guardians if you do not have enough troops to kill them. You absolutely must not lose your Explorer.
Well done–you managed to obtain the required food! I hope that you learned some valuable lessons about using your Explorer and collecting Treasures.
Your Explorer lies wounded somewhere in the wilderness. Try to keep him alive next time.

Use the Explorer’s special ability to kill Treasure Guardians with a single shot. Some Treasure Guardians, such as Outlaw Blowgunners, are especially vulnerable to melee attacks, so you should bring your Explorer within striking distance before engaging them.
You can no longer earn the gold medal, but do not despair! The silver medal is still in reach.
The opportunity to earn a silver medal has passed. However, you can still earn the bronze medal.
The bronze medal is out of reach. Next time, make sure that your Settlers do not go idle.
Learn about Treasures and the Guardians that defend them.
Task all of your Settlers to collect food and do not let them go idle.
Collect the tomato vine Treasure (30 food) with your Explorer. You can use your Explorer's special ability to kill the Guardian with a single shot.
Keep scouting with your Explorer and collect the Treasures that will speed your progress the most.
Welcome! In this challenge, you will learn about the importance of Experience Points and how to earn them.
Remember that Dutch Settlers cost coin instead of food! With this in mind, you should task around five Settlers to mine coin in order to maintain constant Settler production.
In a regular game, there are three ways to receive Experience Points: killing enemy troops and Treasure Guardians, destroying enemy buildings, and collecting Treasures.
Use your Explorer and your Envoy to scout the map. It is important to find Treasures and Trade Routes as quickly as possible, before your enemy can take posession of them.
You have found a Treasure! To claim it, kill the creatures guarding it!
An enemy patrol! Killing those units will yield additional experience!
You have found an unoccupied Trading Post socket! Use your Explorer to build a Trading Post here in order to obtain additional Experience Points.

Excellent! You have built your first Trading Post! Each time the trader passes it, you will earn free Experience Points. Later on, you can upgrade the Trade Route to generate other resources such as food, wood, and coin as well.
The enemy has built a Trading Post on the southern part of the Trade Route. You should tear it down and replace it with one of your own!
The enemy Trading Post is no more and your forces have gained valuable experience! Now, build your own Trading Post on the socket!
You have earned enough Experience Points to order your first shipment!
You have earned enough Experience Points to order your second shipment!
You have earned enough Experience Points to order your third shipment!
You have earned enough Experience Points to order your fourth shipment!
You have earned enough Experience Points to order a final shipment! Good job! Remember, sending the right shipment at the right time can make all the difference.
You narrowly missed earning a gold medal! Now, you must try to aim for the silver medal.
The silver medal is out of reach. Focus on the bronze medal!
You can no longer earn the bronze medal, but you can still finish the challenge.
Learn about Home City shipments and how to gain and use Experience Points.
Earn 5 shipments to complete the challenge.
Home City Shipments are crucial to any game of Age of Empires III: Definitive Edition. Make sure to learn more about them!
Gain 300 experience points to send your first shipment.
Gain 645 experience points to send the second shipment.
Gain 1042 experience points to send the third shipment.
Gain 1498 experience points to send the fourth shipment.
Gain 2023 experience points to send the fifth shipment.
Build a Trading Post on the socket next to the Trade Route.

A Trading Post is an economic building that can only be built on a square-shaped site next to a Trade Route or in a native settlement. If built on Trade Routes, a Trading Post periodically grants experience or resources. If built in a native settlement, it will give the player access to native soldiers and technologies.
Destroy the enemy Trading Post and build your own Trading Post on its ruins.
A Trade Route benefits all players who have built Trading Posts on it. If a player upgrades the route, all players who have built a Trading Post on it will benefit–allies and enemies alike.
Kill the enemy patrol to gain additional Experience Points.
Killing enemy soldiers always yields additional Experience Points. The same applies to destroying enemy buildings.
Loot Treasures to gain additional Experience Points.
Treasures may hold a resource (such as Food, Wood, Coin, or Experience Points), a unit (such as a Pet or a Settler), or an upgrade.
Your town has just reached the Fortress Age. Select your Town Center and train as many Settlers as you can with your remaining food. Set the rally point on a herd of animals for now.
The key to booming is ensuring that your Town Centers are always busy. I say 'Town Centers' because you will need more than just one!
Do not forget to train additional Settlers. Your Town Centers should always be training new Settlers.
Once you can afford it, use your Explorer to build a second Town Center next to the nearby Silver Mine.
You have enough experience to afford a Home City shipment. Send additional Settlers to speed your resource income, or a Covered Wagon or Cords of Wood to build additional Town Centers right away.
You can now send another shipment from your Home City! It is up to you. What will you choose?
Your Settlers need Houses. Be proactive in building Houses to prevent your Town Centers from becoming idle. Monitor your population counter in the resource panel.
You are close to being population capped. Construct Houses to keep up with your Settler production.
Good job! You now have a second Town Center. Queue up some Settlers and task them to gather food and coin.
Research economic technologies at the Market to improve the gathering rate of your Settlers.
Monitor your resources. If you notice that you have a lot of coin compared with food, take Settlers away from coin and have them hunt or build a Mill.
Great! You now have 60 Settlers, but you still must advance to the Industrial Age to complete this challenge.
Excellent! You have reached the Industrial Age, but you still must train 60 Settlers.
Well done! You have 60 Settlers and have advanced to the Industrial Age! Your economy is now powerful enough for you to build large armies and vanquish your enemies!
The gold medal is out of reach, but you still have time to earn the silver or bronze medals.
The bronze medal is still within reach!
Sadly, the chance at a bronze medal has passed. Make sure that you have those Town Centers up and running earlier next time.
Learn how to build a thriving economy in the midgame.
Build additional Town Centers to increase your Settler production. Make sure that your Town Centers are always training new Settlers.
Wood is slower to gather than food or coin. Try to acquire it through Home City shipments when possible and focus your Settlers on gathering food and coin.
Welcome to the Build Order challenge! During this mission, you will learn to perform a common build order for the French civilization. Listen carefully to each of the instructions.
Select your Town Center and queue up one or more Coureurs des Bois.
Send four of the Coureurs des Bois collecting crates to hunt deer. Leave one to finish the remaining crates.
You have finished the starting crates. Send the idle Coureurs des Bois and any new ones that you train to collect food as well.
Remember to drive animals towards your Town Center to minimize the amount of distance that your hunters must walk.
Use your Explorer and your Native Scout to scour the map for important resources. You can also use them to seek and loot Treasures to boost your early economy.
Do not forget about your Explorer and Scout!
You should build a House to make sure that you have enough housing to support any new units.
You have earned a shipment from your Home City. Use it to send three Coureurs des Bois.
Do not let your Town Center become idle. Your success depends on it.
You can now advance to the next age. Select the Town Center, click the Commerce Age button, and select the Quartermaster politician.
Excellent! You are advancing to the next age. Send a Coureur out to each of the nearest animal herds and start driving them back towards your Town Center so that you can gather from them in safety.
Now, task twelve of your Coureurs to gather wood, but keep two hunting to herd the remaining animals.
Now is a good time to send your Explorer to build a Trading Post on the nearby trade route. You will need the extra Experience Points.
You must also build a Market. The Market provides access to technologies that are important for your economy.

Research Hunting Dogs, Placer Mines, and Great Coat at your Market when you can afford them. These technologies are important as they increase the gathering rate of your Coureurs and make them less vulnerable to raids.
Now, switch 9 Coureurs des Bois to food and 5 to coin. Leave none on wood!
You made it to the Commerce Age! Start training more Coureurs des Bois and ship 4 Coureurs from your Home City. You will need 28 of them at the end of this challenge.
Research Steel Traps at your Market.
Do not let your Town Center become idle. You will need many Coureurs de Bois in order to succeed in this challenge.
Every new Coureur des Bois should be tasked to gather food. Keep 5 of your Coureurs mining to ensure a steady supply of coin.
Use the wood gathered from the cords to build a Barracks.
Build two more Houses to support your growing population.
Start training Musketeers at your Barracks without interrupting Coureur production at your Town Center.
Your next Home City shipment should be Cords of 700 Wood.
Use the wood from the cords to build a Stable and 5 Houses. The Houses should be enough to support the population needed to complete this challenge.
Ship a Chest of 700 Gold! This will fund your military production.
Train 10 Hussars at your Stable. You will need a strong army if you are to defeat the enemy.
Excellent! You have completed a build order...but what is this? An enemy army is on its way to destroy your town! Gather your soldiers and drive them off!
The gold medal is no longer attainable. Silver is still up for grabs, however.
You can no longer earn the silver medal, but bronze remains in reach!
The chance to earn a bronze medal has passed, but you can still complete the scenario. Try again later to improve your time!

Well done! You have successfully built a strong economy and an army that can effectively contend with any opponent. It is good to note that, as the French, you have options--you can either stay in the Commerce Age and continue to grow your town, or advance to the next age. Both are viable choices depending on the situation. You are now ready for the next challenge.
Learn about build orders in Age of Empires 3.
Train 14 Coureurs des Bois in total.
Coureurs des Bois are a type of Settler that is unique to the French. They are stronger and collect faster than normal Settlers, but are also more expensive to create.
Make sure that your Coureurs des Bois never go idle. Civilian idle time must be avoided at all costs.
While you are in the Exploration Age, you will only need food. With it, you can support new Coureurs and advance to the next age.
In order to train more units or send unit shipments you will need population room. Build Houses in advance to make sure that your production is not halted by this constraint.
Ship 3 Coureurs des Bois from your Home City.
This is your most important shipment for this particular build order. Three additional Coureurs will boost your economy and push you even closer to the required number of Coureurs.
Advance to the Commerce Age as soon as possible in order to stay ahead of your opponents.
Have 12 Coureurs des Bois cut wood.
You will need wood for Houses.
Drive animals towards your Town Center with 2 Coureurs des Bois.
Continue to drive the animals towards your Town Center by having a Coureur shoot at them from the opposite side. Keep in mind that there is a 12 second cooldown before the animals will move again.
Use your Explorer to build Trading Posts. They are important to maintain map control and yield valuable resource income.
The Market plays host to several upgrades that are necessary to increase the efficiency and strength of your Settlers.
Research Hunting Dogs, Placer Mines, and Great Coat.

Researching Hunting Dogs and Placer Mines will significantly speed up the rate at which your Coureurs collect food from hunting and coin from mining. Great Coat will make your Coureurs more resilient against enemy raids.
Wood gathers very slowly, so it is better to have your Coureurs collect food and coin when possible.
Have 5 Coureurs des Bois mine coin.
Coin is required to train and upgrade many types of military units.
Keep training Coureurs until you have 28 in total.
With 28 Coureurs, you will have a strong enough economy to support a large military force.
Ship 4 Coureurs des Bois from your Home City.
This shipment increases your Coureur count even more while requiring neither resources nor training time at your Town Center.
Research Steel Traps at the Market.
The Steel Traps technology increases the rate at which food is gathered from hunted animals.
Have at least 23 Coureurs des Bois hunt.
Make sure that you continue to drive the animal herds towards your Town Center. The closer that they are, the more efficient and safer that your hunters will be.
You will need a Barracks in order to train the 40 Musketeers required to complete this challenge.
These Houses will support the Coureurs and Musketeers that you are training.
A group of 40 Musketeers will form the core of a powerful attacking force.
Ship Cords of 700 Wood from your Home City.
Wood is normally gathered quite slowly, but this shipment allows you to swiftly increase your wood stockpile without diminishing your food and coin collection.
In addition to the Barracks, you will need a Stable to train cavalry to complement your infantry army.
Hussars take up two population slots instead of one, so you will need more Houses to support all of them.
Ship Chests of 700 Gold from your Home City.
This gold will fund your Hussar production.
Hussars are critical as a counter to any light infantry or artillery that the enemy might build to face your Musketeers.
Ship Cords of 600 Wood from your Home City.
You will need extra wood to build all of the Houses that you need.
The army is upon you! Muster your forces and meet the enemy before they destroy your Town Center! This part of the challenge does not count for your medal time.
Finding Treasures can be advantageous early on.

Your town must advance to the Fortress Age, but the enemy has found you! Quick! Send a Home City shipment of soldiers and prepare to garrison your Settlers. Remember, every garrisoned Settler increases the Town Center’s attack.
Now, call in a group of Minutemen! They will help you defend your Town Center.
Good job! You have successfully defended your settlement...for now, at least.
Remember to not let your Town Center go idle. You should always have Settlers queued up.
You can now advance to the next age! Click the button!
Well done! The enemy was unable to prevent you from reaching the next age.
The opportunity to earn the gold medal has passed, but you still have time to earn the silver medal!
The chance to earn the silver medal has passed, but you still can earn the bronze medal.
You can no longer earn a bronze medal. You can complete the scenario first, or immediately try again to see if you can improve your time.
Learn to defend your settlement in the early game.
Keep your Settlers working as much as possible. You can only advance quickly if you can keep your economy running despite enemy harassment.
Send a Home City shipment to defend your town.
