A shipment of soldiers would come in handy right now to fend off the enemy attackers. Use your Home City to send them in.
Call on Militiamen to defend your settlement.
Try to time the Militiamen so that they arrive at the same time as a shipment of soldiers for maximum efficiency.
The enemy is building up its base undisturbed. This is not acceptable!
One of your Settlers is building a forward Barracks in the center of the map so that you can train soldiers to rush the enemy.
This is your town. You have all that you need to start rushing the enemy. Be quick and kill some enemy Villagers before they can organize a defense!
Do not forget about your shipments. With each shipment, the Germans get free Uhlans that you can use to raid.
You have a decent force. Try to attack the enemy.
One Villager is down. Great work!
That is a second Villager down.
The enemy lost yet another Villager.
You are halfway. Just four more Villagers!
You killed a fifth Villager. Just three more.
A sixth enemy Villagers has fallen.
Just one more Villagers and you are done!
You have killed eight Villagers and crippled the enemy economy. Great job!
Avoid the enemy Town Center! You are not able to assail it at this point.
You missed the gold medal, but do not worry–the other ones are still within reach!
You can no longer earn the silver medal. Push on and try for the bronze medal if you can!
The chance to earn the bronze medal has passed. Next time, be sure to pressure the enemy constantly in this challenge.
Send your army forward and kill 8 enemy Villagers. Avoid the enemy Town Center, however, as it will deal a lot of damage to your soldiers.
Send a shipment from your Home City.
As the Germans, you get free Uhlans with each shipment. Make use of this mechanic and the military shipments to rapidly increase the size of your army.
Create at least three more Settlers.
You should not stop creating Settlers while you are attacking the enemy. Keeping your economy growing is always important.
Producing units to attack your enemy as early as possible is critical to an early offensive strategy.
In this challenge, you must defend your camp against the enemy attacks. Try not to lose too many of your own soldiers.

The enemy is preparing to attack you with Hussars! Study the strengths and weaknesses of the enemy forces and then choose the soldiers that you want to send into battle by clicking the Home City button and then selecting a shipment of soldiers.
The enemy is about to launch a second attack. Choose the right unit to repel these enemy Pikemen!
Now the enemy is sending a group of Crossbowmen! Choose the right counter and defend your land!
Enemy Crossbowmen, Pikemen, and Hussars approach from the south! We must stop them!
You and your enemy have advanced to the Fortress Age but their attacks are not slowing. Choose the right counter units to defeat the Musketeers and Halberdiers marching towards you!
Your opponent refuses to give in! Skirmishers will soon head your way!
What is this? Thundering hooves! The enemy has sent more Hussars to attack your camp!
More enemy cavalry rides towards our camp! These Dragoons must be stopped!
With courage born of despair, your opponent has decided to launch a final attack. If you repel those Cuirassiers, victory will be yours at last!
Excellent! The enemy has been defeated and the region is now under your control!
You will have to earn the gold medal in a different battle, but do not despair! The silver medal is still within reach.
Achieving the silver medal is no longer possible, but achieving the bronze medal still is!
This time you failed to earn a medal, but do not worry. Use the remainder of this attempt to learn more about army compositions. It will certainly help you in the future!
Learn how to make use of the different military unit types.
Defend your camp against the enemy attacks.
If the enemy manages to take the camp, you will lose the challenge.
Defeat the approaching group of enemy Hussars.
Hussars are good at raiding and are strong against artillery. They are also very effective against light infantry. However, they will lose against heavy infantry and ranged light cavalry.
Pikemen are cheap early game units that are good against cavalry and buildings but weak against ranged units.
Crossbowmen do pretty well against most other infantry, with the exception of Skirmishers. They are easily countered by artillery and heavy cavalry.
Defeat the approaching enemy Crossbowmen, Pikemen, and Hussars.
Now, a force composed of different unit types approaches your camp! Use what you have learned to defeat them.
Defeat the approaching enemy Musketeers and Halberdiers.

Musketeers are versatile units with a powerful ranged attack. In melee combat, their bayonet is especially effective as well. Halberdiers are similar to Pikemen but much stronger. Both of these units can be countered by light infantry.
Skirmishers are good at countering heavy infantry and ranged light cavalry, but are highly vulnerable to heavy melee cavalry.
The enemy Hussars have received the veteran upgrade and are now much stronger. You will need a unit from the Fortress Age to defeat them.
Dragoons are excellent mounted counter-cavalry units. They are strong against melee cavalry, but weak against infantry, especially ranged infantry. Dragoons are also vulnerable to melee attacks.

Cuirassiers are some of the strongest cavalry in the game and are unique to the French. You will encounter many unique units like them in Age of Empires 3: Definitive Edition, so take your time to learn what class they belong to and what their strengths and weaknesses are.
Avoid losing more than two units to earn the gold medal.
A clever commander can avoid suffering casualties by micro-managing their army.
Avoid losing more than seven units to earn the silver medal.
Pull back damaged units and lure enemy soldiers into chokepoints to minimize your casualties.
Avoid losing more than twelve units to earn the bronze medal.
Make sure that you understand how the counter system works. Certain units perform much better than others against each unit type.
Pikemen are cheap early game units that are good against cavalry and buildings but weak against ranged units.
Crossbowmen do pretty well against most other infantry, with the exception of Skirmishers. They are easily countered by artillery and heavy cavalry.
Hussars are good at raiding and are strong against artillery. They are also very effective against light infantry. However, they will lose against heavy infantry and ranged light cavalry.
Musketeers are versatile units with a powerful ranged attack. In melee combat, their bayonet is especially effective as well.
Skirmishers are good at countering heavy infantry and ranged light cavalry, but are highly vulnerable to heavy melee cavalry.
Dragoons are excellent mounted counter-cavalry units. They are strong against melee cavalry, but weak against infantry, especially ranged infantry. Dragoons are also vulnerable to melee attacks.
Halberdiers are similar to Pikemen but much stronger. Both of these units can be countered by light infantry.
Welcome! In this challenge, your goal is to reach the far end of the river while losing as few ships as possible.
Watch out! Up ahead is an enemy Outpost. Defensive fortifications like Forts and Outposts deal a lot of damage to ships, so it is best to avoid them.
The first enemy ships that you will face are a few Canoes and one Caravel. Blast them to smithereens!
You can now send a Home City shipment! Will you augment the size of your fleet, improve its firepower, or increase its resilience?
The enemy has docked a Galleon in their Dry Dock. If you destroy the two Caravels defending it, you can board the Galleon and capture it!
Halt! The enemy has stationed artillery on the cliff just ahead. Fear not! By using the Broadside ability of your Frigates and Caravels, you can destroy them in a single volley.
A Fire Ship approaches–destroy it before it sets your fleet aflame!
The enemy navy just downstream is made up of a Frigate and a few Caravels. Focus on the Caravels first, and then destroy the Frigate.
Excellent! The way to the next challenge is open. Hoist the sails!

You have lost too many ships to earn the gold medal, but the silver medal is still within reach! Remember, move your most damaged ships behind your stronger ships and let the vessels with higher hit points soak up most of the damage.
You have lost too many ships to earn the silver medal, but you can still qualify for the bronze medal!
Achieving the bronze medal is no longer possible, but defeating the enemy still is! Try to deploy your remaining ships as effectively as you can.
Remember, you can move your Home City Water Flag to any explored water area by selecting the Flag and clicking the "Set Water Spawn Point" icon.
Learn about the different ship types in Age of Empires 3: Definitive Edition.
Reach the target area with your fleet.
Use your navy to focus down enemy ships one-by-one to quickly sink them and minimize the damage inflicted on your own fleet.
Destroy the enemy Canoes and Caravel.
Canoes are small and quick, but have lower hit points than other ships. You should take them out first.
Galleons are very tough ships, but their firepower is low compared to other ships. Focus on more fragile ships first.
Destroy the enemy Frigate and the Caravels protecting it.
Frigates are very powerful ships. It is wise to goad them to target your Galleons while the rest of your fleet focuses on other targets.
Avoid losing any ships to earn the gold medal.
Try to use your least damaged ships to absorb enemy fire. Move them to and from battle as needed so that the same ship is not always targeted.
Avoid losing more than 2 ships to earn the silver medal.
Focus on one ship at a time. Fewer enemy ships means less damage sustained. Even severely damaged ships still do damage.
Avoid losing more than 4 ships to earn the bronze medal.
Use the Broadside special attack to focus fire on certain targets and pull back any ship that is too severely damaged. They can still shoot from the rear.
Destroy the 2 enemy Caravels to capture a Galleon.
Sink the enemy Caravels guarding the Dry Dock to seize the Galleon docked there and use it for your own ends.
Destroy the enemy artillery battery on the cliff.
Cannons are quite strong against ships, but engaging them is possible. Some ships have the special Broadside ability, which can take out a cannon immediately.

Your army is about to engage an enemy that has a large force of infantry units. Your mission is to avoid as many casualties as possible–employ the artillery units that are best suited for this confrontation.
Select one artillery shipment from your Home City and send the cannons into battle. Remember, your choice should depend on the enemy units that you are going to face.
The battle is about to begin–deploy your cannons and support your soldiers!
Good job! For the next encounter, the enemy is bringing Falconets as well. Ship a new batch of cannons from your Home City and send them into battle.
Great! Now, for the final battle you must destroy the enemy Fort.
Aim your cannons towards the Fort and destroy it before more troops die!
Well done! You have succesfully defeated the enemy and learned about how artillery works. You are ready for the battlefield, Commander!
You have lost too many units for you to earn the gold medal. However, the silver medal is still available.
You have lost several soldiers. The silver medal cannot be achieved, but the bronze medal is still within reach.
You have lost a lot of units! You must try again to earn a medal, but the challenge can still be completed.
Learn how to use artillery–one of the most powerful unit types.
The enemy has arrived with an army of Crossbowmen. Ship in a set of cannons from your Home City to help win the battle.
Your Cossacks and Strelets can deal with the enemy infantry, but the enemy has brought Falconets to the battle.
Your troops are now attacking an enemy Fort. It has a strong wall around it as well, so you will need a large cannon to blast through the defenses.
Avoid more than 8 casualties to earn the gold medal.
Set your cannons in the firing stance before you engage the enemy so that they can fire instantly when the battle starts.
Avoid more than 14 casualties to earn the silver medal.
Focus your fire on the most important targets–such as enemy artillery, forts, or close infantry formations.
Avoid more than 20 casualties to earn the bronze medal.
Be aware of which units each artillery type counters and use this information to your advantage.
Falconets are especially strong against packed groups of infantry.
Culverins are very effective against other cannons, but perform significantly worse against other units or buildings.
The Mortar was built specifically to destroy enemy buildings and naval vessels, so it cannot be used against units.
Don't lose any of your ships
Goal: Train 60 Settlers and advance to the Industrial Age
Goal: Advance to the Fortress Age
Goal: Reach the far end of the river

The rivalry between the Ottoman Empire and the European Christian states allowed piracy to flourish in the Mediterranean during the 16th century. Barbary corsairs like Hayreddin Barbarossa and his brothers were famed for their success at sea. The brothers captured Algiers in 1516, deposing its ruler and establishing a Barbary pirate state. Horrified, the Spanish sent a large army to deal with the corsairs and seize Algiers for themselves.
Unable to take Algiers by force, the Spanish had no other choice than to abandon the long and exhausting siege.

The city remained in the hands of the two corsair brothers, Hizir and Oruc, but rather than keep the title of Sultan of Algiers, the brothers handed the city over to the Ottomans, becoming governors of Algeria under Ottoman protection.
The Spanish feverishly sought to take the city again and again. Even though all of their attacks failed, Oruc was eventually struck down in battle.

Despite or perhaps due to the loss of his older brother, Hizir continued the fight against the Spanish. Working his way up the Ottoman chain of command, he eventually became Grand Admiral of the Ottoman fleet.

He struck a decisive blow against the Christian Holy League at Preveza in 1538, earning himself the nickname Hayreddin Barbarossa - “best of the faith” and “the red bearded”. Under his command, the Ottoman navy dominated the Mediterranean for many decades.

Foraying dauntlessly into the bitter cold, the Cossack Yermak led an expedition of several hundred men to aid Russian merchants in Siberia who were being brutally raided by their Tatar neighbors. The journey was perilous, and the intrepid Cossacks soon found themselves mercilessly harassed as they navigated down the Tura river. Could an army of hundreds prevail against a ruthless horde five times its size? Could gunpowder weaponry put an end to the 2,000 year dominance of nomadic cavalry armies in the field?
The Cossack victory was fatal for the Tatars. Kuchum Khan lost not only his fortress to the Russians, but also many of his followers in battle.

Underestimating the power of modern gunpowder weapons, most of Kuchum's warriors fell victim to the muskets and cannons of the Cossacks. Kuchum himself escaped, but the Khanate of Sibir–the last noteworthy successor of the Golden Horde–fell apart without him, and Russia annexed most of its territory.

Shortly after his triumph, Yermak fell into the hands of marauding Tatars and was killed. Nevertheless, he and his Cossacks were integral to establishing the Russian Tsardom as an aggressive imperial power east of the Urals.

When Queen Elizabeth I formed an alliance with Dutch rebels fighting against Spanish rule, the Spanish King Philip II declared war. In response, the Queen sent the privateer Sir Francis Drake to the Caribbean to lead an attack on the Spanish colonies there.
After plundering the Spanish Caribbean colonies, Sir Francis Drake sailed north to replenish the English colony of Roanoke. From there, he returned to England, receiving a hero’s welcome.

However, his return was bittersweet. War had come, and the Spanish mustered a great armada to invade England itself. As Vice Admiral of the English fleet, Drake's courageous actions helped turn the tide of the battle and saved England from Spanish domination.

As the French and Indian War opened, the French set their sights on an important British border fort near present-day Pittsburgh. Their goal was to seize it. Time was short, however, as the shrewd British commander George Washington would likely send his forces to retake the fort once he heard of its fall.

After de Contrecoeur and his men succeeded in taking Fort Prince George, they strengthened the fortress and renamed it 'Fort Duquesne' in honor of Ange de Menneville, Marquis de Duquesne, the French governor general of Canada.
George Washington fought the French troops successfully for a while, but their reinforcements, which were superior in number, eventually compelled him to retreat.
George Washington was not discouraged by the setbacks, however. The following year, he returned and succesfully drove out the French, who had been abandoned by their Native American allies.
Prior to fleeing, the French burned down the fort, but it was rebuilt once more. The settlement that formed near it in the following years became a grand city, which is known today as Pittsburgh.

The War of 1812 was devastating for the United States, but when the British appeared near New Orleans, hope of a major victory was kindled. As news of the British invasion spread, defenders flocked to the city. Local militia, Native Americans, and even pirates answered the call to arms.
The battle of New Orleans was an important victory for the young American nation.

However, unknown to the soldiers fighting at New Orleans, the United States and the United Kingdom had already brokered a peace treaty prior to the battle. The message had merely not reached the Americas yet.

The Treaty of Ghent ended the exhausting war, and with it the feud that had raged since America’s declaration of independence. A delicate peace between the former colony and its former colonizer eventually blossomed into friendship and alliance between the two nations.

Following in the footsteps of his famous father, Vasco da Gama, Christopher da Gama traveled east seeking riches and adventure. On the East African coast, he learned that the fearsome warlord Ahmed Gragn of the Somali Adal Sultanate and his Ottoman allies had nearly conquered Ethiopia. Da Gama set out to find the Ethiopian Emperor and the powerful Queen Mother and help them retake their empire.
Driven to avenge the death of their captain, the surviving members of Christopher da Gama’s expedition remained in Ethiopia, joining Queen Sabla Wengel and the Emperor Galawdewos.
At the Battle of Wayna Daga, six months after da Gama’s execution, the Portuguese finally had their vengeance.

As the Adal warlord Ahmed Gragn commanded his troops from horseback in the thick of battle, a lone Portuguese soldier fearlessly charged into the Adal lines and fired his arquebus into the warlord’s chest.
Gragn fell dead and the Portuguese avenged their chivalrous captain. Without their leader and withering under the Ethiopian assault, the Adal forces retreated.
Ethiopia, an empire as old as Rome, was saved. It would not be the last time that the Ethiopians fiercely fought to defend their land.
We are in quite the predicament, Brother. The Spanish are at our throats!

Do not worry, Hizir. The Spanish may have surrounded the city, but I have a plan! I have sent men to the Ottoman sultan to ask for help. Inshallah, the sultan will send an army. We must hold on until that help arrives!
The Spanish have constructed siege camps outside of the city gates! As long as they stand, we cannot venture out into the countryside.
We lack the men to go on the offensive, but with Ottoman help we can destroy the four Spanish forts around the city, forcing them to abandon the siege!
Brother! Word comes from the Ottoman Sultan. He is eager to help, but fears that our cause is doomed. Prove to him that the city’s defense is not hopeless, and he will send his army and fleet!
The Spanish have occupied all of the farmland around the city. We should retake it to feed the population of Algiers!
A large silver mine lies to the north. If we retake it, we can extract much coin from it!
The Spanish are using the local trade route to supply their forces. We should destroy their Trading Posts and use the trade route to supply our men instead!
As long as the Spanish blockade the harbor, we will be unable to receive shipments from our pirate base in Cherchell!
The seas are ours again! Now our corsair brethren in Cherchell can send us shipments of goods and reinforcements!
The Spanish have stored large amounts of gunpowder close to the city. Let us blast them to pieces and deprive the Spanish of their firepower!
Selamun aleykum, brothers! Our sultan is a man of his word and sends us to fight by your side. Let us drive these cursed infidels out of Algeria!
The first Spanish fort lies in ruins! Only three more stand!
A second Spanish fort has fallen into our hands! We are halfway there!
That makes three forts, Hizir. Push on, my Barbary brethren! We are almost there!
The last Spanish fort is in our grasp! With Algiers secure, now we can continue our raids on the European coasts with impunity. No town or village will be too small to raid!
This city belongs to the Spanish crown!
Haha excellent! We will see how long these Spanish forts will last without gunpowder!
Why not go back to your peaceful lives as goat herders? The life of a sea dog yields only a gruesome demise.
There is no honor in being a pirate! Give up now, and we may spare some of you.
Burn the camp to the ground! We will drive these Spanish besiegers from Algiers!
Defend Algiers and crush the Spanish invaders.
Do not lose your Town Center.
Do not allow the Spanish to destroy your Town Center. You will lose if they do.
Destroy the three Spanish camps surrounding Algiers.
The Spanish camps form a stranglehold around Algiers, preventing you from gaining access to the resources outside of the city walls.
The Spanish command a powerful position from four nearby forts. Only destroying them will dislodge the besiegers.
Earn 15,000 XP to obtain Ottoman help.
The Ottomans will send you reinforcements if you can accumulate a total of 15,000 Experience Points.
The production from the additional Mills and Estates will allow you to feed your population and train more soldiers.
The silver mine can provide you with additional coin revenue.
The local trade route provides the Spanish forts with critical supplies. Seize it, and it will supply Algiers instead.
Destroy the blockade (Reward: Home City access).
The Spanish naval blockade prevents you from using your Home City. Destroy the blockade to regain access to it.
Without their Weapon Caches, the Spanish will be unable to equip as many cannons as they could before.
Tatars are everywhere! Do not disembark here. We must sail on!
The Watch tower on that island will fill us full of holes if we do not move fast. Hold your fire and rush past it!
We cannot continue by boat! Rugged rocks block the river! We will have to disembark here and continue on foot!
The Tatars set fire to our home village and drove us out! We will help you set up a camp—just avenge our fallen brothers and sisters, Yermak!
The Tatars raid Russian villages. If you men want warm fire and hot food in your bellies, come and burn the Tatar camps and their cursed fortress!
Argh! Vot blin! We were not fast enough. The Tatars burned the village. If you want hot food, the only place you will find it is in the Tatar camp. Onwards, Cossacks! We come for dinner!
I had begun to worry that I had recruited some weak farm boys crying for their babushkas—but you men are strong Russians, indeed! The Tatar camp lies in ruins!
We need your help immediately! The Tatars are besieging our settlement!
Help! The Tatars are attacking our settlement!
These Tatar attacks on Russian homes will not end until we burn their camp to the ground!
The Tatar fortress is formidable, da, but do not be disheartened, men! Fight well, and tonight you will sing songs in the hall of the Tatar khan!
The Tatar fortress lies in ruins! We have conquered Siberia for Mother Russia!
Bread and wood for our protectors!
Find a safe location to unload your boats.
You will only be able to establish a camp if you can find a suitable spot out of sight of the Tatars.
Travel towards the safe location marked on the map.
Unnoticed by the Tatars for now, this location is the only safe place for you to build a camp.
Build a Town Center to establish your camp.
Use the Covered Wagon to quickly construct a Town Center and start building your camp.
Destroy the Tatar fortress of Qashliq.
Without their fortress, the Tatars will no longer be able to control the region.
Protect the Russian village to the north.
The allied village will provide you with resources, making it easier for you to train and equip additional soldiers.
Destroy the Tatar camp to end their raids.
Destroy the Tatar field camp so that you can concentrate on besieging Qashliq.
Lads, we come here to raid these Spanish devils and plunder their riches for our beloved England and our Good Queen Bess!
El Draque, I presume? Leave these Spanish waters or we will blow your ships to the bottom of the sea! Already, my king prepares an armada to take your little island!
Get aboard, privateers! There are many spoils for us to take!
You hate the Spanish? Aye, you have found good company in us!
Hoy! Come along with us and we shall part the Spanish devils from their bloody doubloons!
We rob and pillage the Spanish of their ill-gotten gains for Queen and Country! Join us, eh?
I care not for your crimes committed against the hated Spanish. You fight hard and Her Majesty’s fleet will gladly have you!
An Englishman cavorting with pirates and heathens. How typical...
Spanish treasure galleon sighted! Brimmin' with gold!
Ransack the colony! Check the officers' quarters for the soldiers' pay!
¡Dios mío! Stop El Draque before he ruins our colonies!
Open every chest and overturn every bed, lads! We will find the Spanish gold!
Spaniards, do not make a fool of me before the king! Stop El Draque or I will put you all on half rations!
These Spanish are no match for us Englishmen! Let us return to dear old England with stories to make the lads jealous and many doubloons in our pockets!
Word of our exploits has reached Plymouth! Her Majesty sends more men eager for adventure!
Slow down, boys! That Spanish cannon will blast our ships into a thousand little splinters. We must find another way into the colony!
Excellent! That Spanish coastal gun will give us no more trouble.
Destroy 5 Spanish colonies in the Caribbean by killing the soldiers defending them.
Use the resources gained from destroying colonies to train units at your Galleon.
Capture the moored Spanish Treasure Ship.
A Spanish Treasure Ship can be captured for additional gold income.
Find English Pirates to join Drake’s expedition.
You will encounter friendly pirates if you explore the islands and coasts.
The Spanish colony of Cartagena is protected by a large coastal gun. You should disable it before it can sink any of your ships.
The British control the river fork with this little fort that they call "Fort Prince George." When we conquer it, we will be able to protect New France from these encroaching British colonials!

The British forces are too many to be defeated without the help of allies. Our scouts report that the British oppress three local native settlements. If we drive out the occupiers, the natives will surely join us!
Sacre bleu! We should not be marching towards the British camps! We have a fort to conquer first!
I have spoken to the Seneca chief and he will fight alongside his French brothers. He hopes that the French tribe will not forget his people’s friendship.

The Lenni Lenape chief says that no man can claim ownership of the lands granted by the Creator. He says that he will resist the British because they are hungry for the land that belongs to the wolf and the turtle.
My Shawnee brothers and sisters are much too proud to bow to the British. Their chief says that just as day and night cannot live together, they cannot live with the British.
The fort now belongs to New France, but George Washington and his dirty colonials will not wait long to challenge us! We will show les rosbifs our French courage!
The British are using boats to land soldiers behind our fort! Vite! Push them back into the river!
Another British landing party! Do not let them destroy our town!
We have held the British at bay thus far, but now they are sending their main force! To the ramparts! Protect the fort! Vive la France! Vive le Roi!
Your Seneca allies have been defeated by the British. Their chief expresses hope that one day there will be a lasting peace between the French and British peoples.
The Lenni Lenape chief says that the losses of his men are too great. Fathers, brothers, and sons are needed for the harvests or his people will wither like flowers cut from the Earth Mother.
My Shawnee brothers fought bravely, but the British were stronger. Their chief says that the natives of this land must learn to unite if they are to drive the British from here.
The redcoats are running! They are no match for the French spirit...but I fear that they will return again.
Seize the British fort and defend it.
Capture the British fort by defeating the garrison defending it.
Use cannons to blast your way into the fort and kill the British Garrison.
Defend the fortress against the British.
You will lose if the British manage to destroy the fort's Command Post. Victory will be achieved If you can defend it until the enemy runs out of supplies and reinforcements.
Liberate the Seneca from the British occupying forces.
The Seneca will aid you if you free them from the British.
Liberate the Lenni Lenape from the British occupying forces.
The Lenni Lenape will aid you if you free them from the British.
Liberate the Shawnee from the British occupying forces.
The Shawnee will aid you if you free them from the British.
The Seneca will supplement your forces with Tomahawks and Kanya Horsemen.
The Lenni Lenape will supplement your forces with Aennas and Forest Prowlers.
The Shawnee will supplement your forces with Musket Riders and Warriors.
Time left to defend the fort
General, militia from Louisiana, Tennessee, Kentucky, and Mississippi report for duty! The men are ready for inspection.
Quick! Let me in! I bring news and demand to see the general!
General! The British are preparing for battle! They will soon launch their attack!
Then we will give 'em an explosive American reception! Lieutenant, form up the men and unlimber the cannons! Let's get to it, boys!
One hand washes the other, Monsieur. If you help me build a Trading Post for my... "business ventures," I will help you get supplies past the British, mon ami.
I don't cotton to makin' friends with pirates and scoundrels like this Lafitte. But if we're to hold the line against these British, I'm not one to be picky.
A promise is a promise, Général. My... "business associates" will help you, but don't forget our friendship, mon ami! I look forward to having such an influential friend in the American government.
The Choctaw Nation does not bow to the British. We will fight alongside the Americans, General, but we need muskets!

General, we can produce a Black Powder Wagon at our Town Center ourselves, but it is costly. Another option is to retrieve a Black Powder Wagon left on the battlefield, but the area is crawling with redcoats.
We gave the Choctaw the muskets and boy were they pleased! They had me grinnin' like a possum eatin' a sweet 'tater! I think we'll be all right with them fightin' alongside us!
The enemy has destroyed a cart with muskets collected for the Choctaw! All that work won't amount to a hill of beans now! We'll have to try again!
We have lost too many of our warriors! The Choctaw can no longer participate in this fight.
General! The British are comin'! I hope we're ready or we'll be hanging on like a hair in a biscuit!
The British have seized the artillery position on the other side of the Mississippi. They will be sailing their war vessels up the river at any moment. I need men now to go and retake that position!
The artillery position is now operational. When the British ships arrive, we will show them some American fireworks!
The British ships have been spotted entering the Mississippi Delta! Get goin', men! Secure that fixed gun position or their ships will sail through with impunity!
The British war boats have been spotted in the Mississippi Delta! They will be here soon! Get that cannon ready!
The British are sendin' their war boats! Use our fixed gun position to blast them before they reach New Orleans!

We've failed to repair the artillery position and the British ships are now on their way to New Orleans! Get off your backsides and protect the city! You will have to use your muskets now that we don't have that fixed gun to help us.
Hold the line, men! The British don't have as much fight in them as we do! Hold on a little longer and they're sure to break!
The British are awfully near to New Orleans and we're moving slower than molasses in winter! Let's get going before they take the city and we lose this battle!
We’ve got the British runnin' scared! Keep after them, men! Let's go to their camps and show 'em a little American spirit!
The British are in New Orleans! How could we allow this to happen?
Huzzay! New Orleans is saved and we’ve taught these British a lesson in American gumption!
Drive off the British marching on New Orleans.
Prepare the defense of New Orleans.
Use the time left until the British attack to fortify your camp and find yourself some allies.
Fend off the British until their supplies run out.
The British must not reach New Orleans.
Not a single British soldier must reach the outskirts of New Orleans.
To achieve victory, defeat the British by destroying their camp.
Build a Trading Post in Jean Lafitte’s camp (Reward: three free shipments).
If you earn Jean Lafitte's support, he will provide you with some free shipments and you will be able to train mercenaries at his Saloon.
Arm the Choctaw with gunpowder weaponry by bringing one Black Powder Wagon to their settlement.
If you supply the Choctaw with gunpowder, they will train warriors to assist you.
Eliminate the enemy troops guarding the broken Fixed Gun on the Mississippi riverbank.
If you manage to capture and fix the destroyed artillery piece in time, you will be able to fend off the British warships.
Time left until the first British attack
The enemy are too many! Fall back to the Ethiopians or we will be captured and tortured like da Gama!
Why do you run? The Adal Sultanate is that way. Now, where is your captain, Christopher da Gama? I will address your cowardice with him personally!
Your majesty, our captain has been murdered by the Adal warlord Ahmed Gragn. We came to join you so that we can recover da Gama’s body and have our vengeance on his murderer.
Then you will listen to my commands. Liberate the highland villages. Tell the people that their emperor lives and you will strengthen my armies as they push through the valleys.
You may use my town to receive reinforcements from Portugal. If my son and I are to defeat Ahmed Gragn, we will need more than a few cowardly Portuguese who let their captain be murdered.
The Viceroy of India sends reinforcements. He demands that we bring the head of Gragn as payment for his brother’s death.
My armies will be attacking in the direction of the Adal camp. Travel to the villages so that more warriors join our forces!
Attack, my warriors! Reclaim the land that is rightfully yours!
Portuguese! The enemy is in our camp! Come quickly!
My dear children, these Portuguese have swept the Adal forces from your village. Join the imperial armies to free all of our lands from the invaders!
You Portuguese are like flies on a buffalo’s back. Know this: your captain did not die well. Surrender now, or you can expect the same fate.
Children of Ethiopia, your emperor is descended from King Solomon. Show that we are worthy of our ancestors!
Rise, Ethiopians! Throw the foreign invaders from our borders!
These villages mean nothing to me. I will turn Ethiopia into a wasteland before I suffer a defeat.
The great Emperor Galawdewos, my son, has returned to command our armies. Adal will be no match for his skill in battle!
We have nearly driven the Adal armies from our lands. Push into their camp and we will free our people!

Portuguese, you have done your duty to your slain captain. Return to Portugal and tell your king that Ethiopia appreciates good and loyal friends…but let him know how hard we fight to defend our lands.
Help the Ethiopians defeat the Adal Sultanate.
Escape the Adal forces and reach the Ethiopians.
Christopher da Gama is dead and so you must flee to safety. Try to avoid fighting the Adal soldiers until your men are safe.
Help the Ethiopians defeat the Adal Sultanate.
The Ethiopians and Adal are constantly fighting each other in the valleys. Support the Ethiopians and help them gain the upper hand over their enemies.
You will lose if the Ethiopian town is destroyed, so be sure to keep some soldiers in reserve near your allies in case things start to look bad.
Drive the Adal forces from the Ethiopian villages to strengthen the Ethiopian army.
The villages will send some warriors to attack the Adal and place others under your command as well.
You have been banned from sending messages.
You have been blocked from sending messages.
Your account is unable to send text chat.
You are already a member of a this chat
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing attack of ranged units
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing attack of hand units
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing hitpoints of military units
%ls = Golden Pavilion increasing speed of military units
Spreading like wildfire until they covered the land.
After the war my father went home, he would never be a wealthy man for he'd spend a considerable inheritance outfitting his militia volunteers and supplying the troops at Valley Forge.
He was a patriot, a good father and one of the best my family ever produced.
If Nathaniel had a flaw it was that his legacy was a difficult one to live up to.
Especially his grandson, my only child Chayton Black.
Whatever the truth, in the end he made the choice he had to make. Whether he made the right choice...well history will be the judge of that.
Dock warship improvements cost and research time significantly reduced.
Find House, Longhouse, Teepee, Shrine, Village or Torp
Find Mill, Farm or Rice Paddy
Find Church, Mosque, Community Plaza or Monastery
Find Barracks, Blockhouse, War Hut or War Academy
Find Stables, Corral, Nobles Hut, Caravanserai or Kallanka
Find Artillery Foundry, Siege Workshop or Castle
Some particle effects will not display properly
This version cannot be played offline. Please connect to the internet and re-launch the game
Search for a clan using keywords.
Add a name for your clan.
Host a game with given details.
Saved game: %s is not a saved multiplayer game.
An error occurred when loading saved game %s.
You must watch the cinematic before attempting this challenge
Settlers gather more quickly instead of becoming Revolutionaries and can garrison in Trek Wagons for transport and protection. Ships 3 Trek Wagons.
Enables Coureurs to be trained from Town Centers. Permits you to train 30 Coureurs in addition to the usual Villager build limit.
Ships 1 Prospector Wagon looking for a Diamond Mine.
All Settlers and Wagons move faster and all units have more hitpoints.
Delivers 900 Food, 3 Cows, 3 Goats, 3 Sheep and 1 Homestead Wagon.
Can be garrisoned by Villagers for transport and protection. Becomes faster and stronger the more units are garrisoned.
Voluntarios da Patria rally to your cause!
Revolutionaries have 25% more hitpoints, but are more expensive.\n\nTown Centers and Taverns spawn pirates for free. Privateers can be hired at Docks.
A dangerous outlaw on horseback armed with a rifle. Effective against Heavy Cavalry and Heavy Infantry.
Ships 8 semi-fattened Cows, 1 Jagunço and 1 Homestead Wagon
Ships 7 dangerous Grizzly Bears. O Canada!
10 Jagunços and 10 Cows. Allows recruitment of Jagunços at Taverns, Stables, Forts and Galleons.
Enables Citizens at the Town Center and grants a steady trickle of Coin.
Dragoons upgrade to Independence Dragoons who have a powerful lance attack at close range.
Ships 6 Settlers and enables Settlers at the Town Center.
Allows Settler training at the Town Center and grants a steady trickle of Food.
3 Native Embassy Travois. Allows the recruitment of Comanche Horse Archers, Cheyenne Riders, Sharktooth Bowmen and Klamath Riflemen at Native Embassies.
Militiamen become Minutemen who no longer lose hit points and can now be called at Forts. Delivers 16 Minutemen.
Ships 1 Mortar and upgrades Mortars to Imperial Howitzers.
All Blockhouses spawn a Hungarian Grenadier and every shipment delivers an extra Outpost Wagon. Settlers become Grenzers - Revolutionaries with more range but less hitpoints.
All existing Outposts and Blockhouses spawn a Magyar Hussar.
All Blockhouses spawn a Roșior Dragoon and every shipment delivers an extra Blockhouse Wagon. Settlers become Dorobants, who trade range for more hitpoints
Solid general-purpose infantry which trades range for hitpoints. Good against cavalry.
All existing Outposts and Blockhouses spawn a Roșior Dragoon
3 Native Embassy Travois. Allows the recruitment of Cree Coreurs, Cree Trackers, Huron Mantlets and Nootka Clubmen at Native Embassies.
3 Native Embassy Travois. Allows the recruitment of Zapotec Lightning Warriors, Mayan Holcan Spearmen, Navajo Riflemen and Apache Cavalry at Native Embassies.
Ships 1 Frigate and 1 Monitor. Instead of a Mameluke you get an extra Privateer.
The Sufi deliver a bonus Elephant with all future shipments! (Including this one)
TEAM Ships 10 Bison and improves gathering rate from hunted animals
Ships 8 semi-fattened Cows, 1 Gaucho, and 1 Homestead Wagon.
Conscription: Call an army of Minutemen to defend this fort!
Levy: Call a handful of Minutemen to defend this fort!
Randomly selects from among all Competitive Maps.

It's autumn in Korea - players will find themselves nestled between flowers, falling leaves and all shades of red and orange. This picturesque, peninsular region gently touches the coast to the north where there are fishing opportunities; though no whales this far inland. Find a trading route to the south which passes through each team's side of the map.

Korea: a peninsular region that touches the ocean in the north with a trading route to the south.

Settlements: Jesuit
Outlaws: Wokou Horesman, Wokou Ronin

In this beautiful northern wilderness, players begin surrounded by forests, mountains and cliffs overlooking the ocean. This mineral-rich region sports plenty of silver mines, as well as gold mines deposited directly below the mountains. There are no trading routes, but a few fishing boats will prove economically valuable.

Alaska: a beautiful, coastal wilderness with plenty of mines - find gold deposits near the mountains.

Settlements: Nootka
Outlaws: Comanchero, Renegado

Players will find no shortage of resources on the open Punjabi plains. Water buffalo graze nearby the fordabable river to the north, across which lies fertile grassland, berry bushes, and two Udasi temples. The south sports a trading route which gently borders the Thar Desert. With densly packed forests and a starting mango grove rickshaw, there will be absolutely no shortage of wood.

Punjab: a trading route and fordable river flow through the open Punjabi plains.

Settlements: Udasi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Thuggee, Marathan Catamaran

This coastal peninsular region sees players begin on opposing shorelines divided by a mountain range. Teams must control the wide central pass, or sneak through narrower chokes as they vie for control of a winding trade route and the surrounding resource. Keep an eye out for enemy docks on your side!

Baja California: two opposing shorelines are divided by a mountain range with several chokepoints.

Settlements: Apache, Navajo, Maya
Outlaws: Comanchero, Renegado

Situated in the Sundarbans of the Bay of Bengal, players initially begin on dry land. Teams share a modest starting plateau with limited space and resources - but both run out quickly and expansion will be necessary! Though, due to seasonal flooding; beyond lies vast swampland and dense mangrove forest where land is premium and walls are difficult to build.

Bengal: vast swampland and dense mangrove forest lie beyond a spacious starting area.

Settlements: Udasi, Sufi, Bhakti
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado, Marathan Catamaran

Players begin on opposite sides of a valley, nestled within the Cascade Range. There are only small tin mines and not many animals to hunt. A smattering of berries surround the lakes - which can be fished - though neither will be particularly bountiful. Be quick to collect the many unguarded muskrat treasures, because you won’t find much else...

Cascade Range: A snowy valley with very limited resources and treasures.

Settlements: Klamath, Nootka
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

The Fertile Crescent is divided into three regions by rivers with shallow crossings. Teams begin on the central plain where there are fewer resources compared to the surrounding east and west. Maintaining control of each region and its trading posts is tough - you can’t be everywhere! Form an alliance with the Sufi for some powerful late-game upgrades.

Fertile Crescent: a pair of rivers divide the region into three - being everywhere can be challenging!

Settlements: Sufi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Thuggee, Marathan Catamaran

The Floridian coast boasts sandy beaches, a starting market, and a trading route which passes through every player's town. Food is exceptionally abudant here -- players will find plenty of turkeys and deer to hunt; as well as sheep and fish to gather. Native Seminole and Carib tribes offer some incredibly powerful archer technologies - beware!

Florida: players begin on the coast with a market and spawn on top of the trading route.

Settlements: Seminoles, Caribs
Outlaws: Pirate

Players find themselves in a hot, semi-arid lowland with no access to trading routes. Instead, players must fight to control the center of the map where there are plenty of Rhea and Guanco to hunt as well as llamas to tame. The Chaco Plain is very open! Only a few small ponds break up the landscape - be prepared for raiding on all sides...

Gran Chaco: wild llamas and plenty of wildlife roam the South American Chaco Plain.

Settlements: Tupi
Outlaws: Pistolero, Pirate

The Central Plain is the most populous region of China, home to many Shaolin settlements and wildlife aplenty. An extensive trading route spans across the fertile, open grassland - controlling this is a surefire way to a powerful economic victory. Fierce competition over each post is essential!

Central Plain: a long trading route spans across the open plains of central China.

Settlements: Shaolin
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

Summer or winter, there is no shortage of resources here. Constructing defenses on the islands in the sea, or nearby the Cree and Huron settlements will help control the ocean. Forming an alliance with either of these natives will unlock some fantastic economic options. The position of the trading route varies but is always in the middle of the map.

Saguenay: a coastal region with plenty of resources. It may be summer or winter.

Settlements: Cree, Huron
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

A watercourse divides the region and forks in the center to form an island. Shallow crossings offer passage but only in predictable locations -- a keen awareness of your opponent will be rewarded as they can only approach you from limited angles. There are no natives here, but a friendly macaque awaiting rescue next to your town will help you scout for goats.

Kamchatka: A watercourse divides the region and forks in the center to form an island.

Settlements: Klamath, Nootka
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Wokou Horesman

Players find themselves on the Manchurian coast where cliffs and rock overlook sizable fish-stocks. Yaks and trees are sparcely littered across this harsh, open landscape - whilst the wood supply may be limited, controlling a few trading posts should more than make up for it. Teams will find an easily defendable route behind their base... or maybe it will be out in the open towards the northwest - either is possible.

Manchuria: a coastal region sparcely littered with trees and yaks. The trading route position varies.

Settlements: Shaolin, Zen
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Wokou Pirate

Teams find themselves on opposite sides of an enormous, but beautiful mountain peppered with flowers, ferns and red maples. South of it lies the ocean, and north of it lie two valuable trading routes, as well as Zen devotees. Players will do battle on these two fronts - you won’t find other ways around the mountain!

Hokkaido: players do battle around the foot of a beautiful Japanese volcano.

Settlements: Zen
Outlaws: Wokou Horesman, Wokou Ronin

Wild llamas roam the western Pampian mountains, and players must choose whether to invest into the wealth of livestock, or take their chances picking out the first treasures in the lowlands. This semi-arid region offers no trading routes, though Mapuche settlements populate the landscape -- player should watch out for potential alliances that can offer a variety of early aggressive options as well as valuable lategame technologies.

Pampas Sierras: Wild llamas roam the mountains to the West - there are many Mapuche settlements but no trading routes.

Settlements: Mapuche
Outlaws: Comanchero, Pistolero

Divided by a rockface, teams begin on opposites sides of this frosty, mountainous region. Three fairly open passages permit movement between each side -- though trading routes meander through each, making them difficult to fully wall. Researching Stagecoach or Ironhorse here will upgrade every traderoute - be careful not to aid your opponents.

Colorado: a frosty mountainous region with a trading route that meanders through chokepoints.

Settlements: -
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

In pursuit of the Northwest Passage, players find themselves lost in the Arctic archipelago, confined to a windy and desolate island. The sheer ice cliffs make it completely inaccessible by ship - docks cannot be constructed. Resources are limited, especially coin, though a trading route can be found to the southeast.

Arctic Territories: a desolate land in the Arctic archipelago - wind, snow and ice aplenty.

Settlements: -
Outlaws: Pistolero, Comanchero

Teams begin on opposite sides of the Malaysian peninsula next to separate, easily defendable oceans. Two trading posts can be found in the far corners of the map, not so far away from a Sufi or Jesuit settlement, tucked behind the wallable treelines. Each player's starting tin mines won’t supply much coin; look to the whales, or silver deposits scattered around the map for more, where you will also find water buffalo to tame.

Malaysia: a peninsular region with separate, defendable oceans on each side.

Settlements: Jesuit, Sufi
Outlaws: Marathan Catamaran

Players will find wide-open prairies peppered with flowers, ponds and forests. Two red mesas restrict movement through the middle of the map -- but also create lots of defendable positions! Form an early alliance with the natives for some powerful economic options; the Cree will supply coureur des bois and the Commanche can reduce the coin cost of all technologies and wonders. Researching stagecoach or Ironhorse here will upgrade every traderoute - be careful not to aid your opponents.

Dakota: two dusty red mesas occupy the center of wide-open prairies.

Settlements: Comanche, Cree
Outlaws: Renegado, Pirate

With scorching rays and dried-up ponds, this particular region of Mexico is hot and dry - but certainly not barren. Plenty of pronghorn, and even a few bison, roam this semi-arid landscape. Veins of copper will supply adequate coin, but there are very limited trees. A large mesa occupies the center of the map through which a lengthy trading route passes by. Surrounding it are several native settlements; players will sometimes find the Apache and Navajo, but at other times the Zapotec and Maya.

Mexico: a lengthy trading route passes through a large central mesa.

Settlements: Navajo, Apache, Zapotec, Maya
Outlaws: Comanchero, Pistolero

Teams begin exceptionally close to each other and are surrounded by plenty of resources - walling up and playing defensively will be easier than usual. There are no rivers in this region of the Andes… only a trading route and wide-open mountains where many native Inca settlements occupy the chokepoints.

Andes - Upper: teams begin exceptionally close to each other - perfect for the Treaty game mode.

Settlements: Incas
Outlaws: Pistolero, Renegado

Players begin in a southerly position, nestled between three parallel rivers. This scenic region boasts many treasures and plenty of natural resources - though all of them upstream. There are no trading routes here, so teams must push northward towards the mountains. There, goats roam freely - though will need to be escorted home... it’s a long journey back.

Parallel Rivers: wade upstream in pursuit of treasures, goats and resources. The rivers can be crossed on foot.

Settlements: Zen
Outlaws: Wokou Horseman, Wokou Monk

Teams find themselves situated on a large, bountiful island, surrounded by smaller ones, amidst the Indonesian archipelago. There are no trading routes here, meaning that a fishing economy and naval presence is absolutely necessary! Wild water buffalo roam all of the islands; use your starting catamaran to bring them back to your town where you begin with an extra coin crate and saloon or equivalent building.

Indonesia: a large island surrounded by smaller ones amidst an enormous, fish-laden archipelago.

Settlements: Jesuit, Sufi
Outlaws: Marathan Dacoit, Marathan Pirate, Marathan Catamaran
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of maps that welcome strategic diversity and civilization variety.
Randomly selects from among all Asian maps, among both competitive and casual sets.

Northwest Territory: a green and rainy region divided by rivers with shallow crossings.

Settlements: Nootka, Klamath
Outlaws: Comanchero, Renegado
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of maps which are ideal for Team Games.
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of Land Maps.
Randomly selects from a tailored pool of Naval Maps.
Randomly selects from among all American maps, among both competitive and casual sets.
Upgrades this Trade Route to use Traveling Merchants, which can deliver resources, move faster, and provide greater line of sight.
Send more of our young men into battle! We cannot let the enemy achieve such a cowardly victory.
Inti shines his light upon Huayna Capac's warriors! He will grant us a glorious victory!
We do not have such weapons. Perhaps you are willing to share your knowledge of this 'artillery' with my people?
The Inca have no need for large dogs. Huayna Capac can fill whole valleys with his warriors.
Agreed, Inca warriors will bring victory.
It is you who should pay tribute to the Sapa Inca, not the other way around!
The Inca warriors are harvesting the crops! You will need to wait before they can take up arms again.
Nothing is impossible for the Sapa Inca—except for this.
Huayna Capac needs time to gather his vast army from the four corners of the world.
These people dare to destroy our Trading Posts! May my stone mace smash their weak skulls!
Our Aztec neighbors cannot wait to become Inca subjects. Huayna Capac will fulfill their wish!
The British tried to trade hot water for coca. For this, Huayna Capac will push them into the sea!
The Dutch asked for too many discounts. Now they will have to pay for everything!
Huayna Capac will show no mercy unless the French submit to him now!
These Germans have already lost to Huayna Capac, they just do not realize it.
Huayna Capac defeated the Haudenosaunee horses and gunpowder with slings and stones! That is pure skill.
The Ottomans always sent the same warriors. That was their downfall.
The Portuguese will perish at the hands of the Inca warriors!
The Russians think that they have many warriors. Huayna Capac will show them otherwise!
The large dogs of the Lakota did not enjoy dancing the Boleadoras with us. Too bad, it's so much fun!
The Spanish are as weak as their constructions. They will tremble before the Inca Empire!
There can only be one Sapa Inca! Death to the traitor!
These British have become powerful. The Inca warriors must fight even more fiercely if they wish to gain the favor of their emperor.
The Dutch continue to be a thorn in my side. Huayna Capac demands that their threat to his authority end now!
Did the gods not accept our lavish offerings? Why do they let the French continue with impunity?
Huayna Capac expected the Germans to have succumbed to their fermented drinks by now—yet they continue to defy the Sapa Inca!
Huayna Capac has much respect for a warrior people like the Haudenosaunee.
The Ottomans have an empire on par with that of the Sapa Inca. Huayna Capac respects that.
The Portuguese have a strong force. It will require many more Inca warriors to turn the tide.
These Russians flood the battlefield with their soldiers. They are not to be underestimated.
Perhaps the Lakota were right to adopt the large dogs. The Inca should do so as well.
The Spanish thunder weapons and shiny metal swords have proven to be quite effective against my Inca warriors.
This false Sapa Inca has much support. In the end, however, only Huayna Capac will remain standing.
While my people worship me, they forget to innovate like your people do.
Your technological advantage is impressive, use it well to gain the edge on the battlefield.
Do not linger in the first age. Our enemies only respect strength, which comes with a large army.
Huayna Capac demands that you advance to the next age!
You advance quickly, but can your military match Huayna Capac's?
Huayna Capac hopes that you are faster at fighting than you are at researching technologies.
Huayna Capac has lost interest in this battle. He has more important matters to attend to elsewhere.
Assist me, lest you prefer to continue the fight on your own.
My people are weak and my empire lies in ruins. Send your warriors before it is too late!
I am Huayna Capac, Sapa Inca of the mighty Inca Empire, god among men, ruler of many.
Huayna Capac accepts your support. May we crush those who oppose us with ease.
I see that you have become stronger since last we met. So have I.
The weaker the enemies, the easier it will be to crush their spirits.
Huayna Capac remembers how you defeated his warriors in battle last time. Now we will unleash that fury on the enemy.
Huayna Capac is nothing if not gracious. You will have a place at his side at the next banquet.
Huayna Capac hopes that you will put up a better fight this time around.
The Inca tend to put wounded animals out of their misery. Do not force Huayna Capac's hand.
These lands are known to the Sapa Inca.
The Inca people have suffered enough. Huayna Capac demands that you bring him victory!
The sounds of victory still resonate to this day! Another dawn, and another victory is upon us!
My Warchief has returned to my court. After he is done crawling through the dirt, asking for my forgiveness, he will resume his duties.
Huayna Capac grants you this generous gift of gold.
Here is some gold, use it wisely.
The Inca know over 4,000 different types of staple food. Have some.
My people gathered an excess of food. Huayna Capac lets you have some of it.
Take this wood. Huayna Capac no longer desires it.
Huayna Capac can spare this wood for you.
My priests consulted the Huaca and we are told that we must march to war.
Huayna Capac's warriors are upon the enemy's town. They will spare no one!
Enough! Huayna Capac will no longer allow this minor tribe to side with his enemies.
Trade can only benefit the Inca Empire. Burn it down!
Huayna Capac was already planning to go to battle. You may join him.
Huayna Capac has called for new blood to join his mighty army.
Huayna Capac's empire needs to expand. This is a good place for a new city.
There is no end to the riches of Huayna Capac's empire. You can have a fraction of them.
Our stores are bursting with food. Of course Huayna Capac will share with his ally.
Huayna Capac's people have cut down many forests. Appreciate their hard work and do not waste the wood.
The messengers have delivered the quipus. Huayna Capac's warriors rush to your aid!
You are invited as an honored guest at the next festival of Inti. Be amazed as you witness a month of dancing, feasting, and lavish gifts.
May I interest you in a visit to Huayna Capac's royal palace at Machu Picchu? The view from its terraces is breathtaking.
Huayna Capac demands tribute! Send him your coin!
Huayna Capac needs to feed his people! Share what food you have.
The gods demand that you give Huayna Capac wood so that he might build a large bonfire for sacrificial offerings.
The Sapa Inca appreciates this gift of coin.
Our storage houses are full of food once again. Huayna Capac thanks you.
The Sapa Inca will not forget your good deeds.
Huayna Capac, Emperor of the fearsome Inca, thanks you for your fitting tribute.
This wood will not go to waste.
The Aztecs seem to have bested Huayna Capac. We will give them the sacrifices that they demand.
These British...that "tea" that they drink must be a magical potion of strength!
No wonder the Dutch have amassed a larger army than Huayna Capac—they trade with all these shiny metals!
Huayna Capac will have to surrender to the French. Do they know of surrender?
The Germans invade Huayna Capac's trails with their wanderlust. We are being overrun!
The adoption of gunpowder and horses pays off too well for the Haudenosaunee.
Ottoman artillery makes Huayna Capac's mighty walls shake. This is a bad omen.
The Portuguese flag is waving strongly in the wind. It is going to blow Huayna Capac away!
Are the Russians playing by the rules? Huayna Capac does not seem to have a chance.
Huayna Capac loves his llamas, but he finds Lakota horses superior. We may need a horse god now.
The Spanish come for Huayna Capac's gold. Give them some trinkets and send them back on their way before they destroy Huayna Capac's empire.
This treacherous Sapa Inca seems to have Inti's blessing. What did Huayna Capac do to make the gods forsake him!
The feathered serpent of the Aztecs has poisoned our gods. They fooled Huayna Capac!
These British are like a tiny dog. All bark, no bite.
It seems that the Dutch came to make a bargain—and a bargain they found.
The French chased away Huayna Capac's llamas. What will Huayna Capac eat now?
These Germans drank all of our beverages. Huayna Capac is close to dying of thirst!
Huayna Capac's warriors flee the din of Haudenosaunee horses and muskets.
It seems that the Ottomans were only interested in llama meat and we just got in their way.
The Portuguese did not even put up a fight. They just founded more towns than us—and won.
Huayna Capac's warriors would have won the battle if they had not lost the drinking contest against the Russians.
Our bolas cannot snare the smooth legs of Lakota horses. It is hopeless.
Those bearded Spanish may be few but their fighting tactics were...unexpected.
What is this treachery! Only Huayna Capac can be the true Sapa Inca!
Huayna Capac's warriors have lost the favor of the gods. We are losing.
You must start proving yourself a worthy ally or Huayna Capac will turn you into one of his subjects.
Huayna Capac's warriors cut through the enemy like maize on a harvest day. The Sapa Inca is pleased with his subjects.
Huayna Capac does not do the dirty work himself—he makes others do it for him.
Once again, the Inca have won the day! Huayna Capac hopes that you will at least try next time.
Huayna Capac has seen enough bloodshed. He wishes to retire to his palace.
Huayna Capac recognizes that he has lost this battle. He will have to try his luck at another, more opportune time.
Emperor Huayna Capac yearns for his home in Machu Picchu. It is time to end this war.
The enemy is afraid of Huayna Capac's armies. Let us make them confront their fears!
The enemy managed to persuade the natives to join their side, let us convince them otherwise.
You have found your first treasure. May many more follow.
You will share your treasures, no? Huayna Capac expects lavish gifts.
Huayna Capac sees that you appreciate shiny metals as well.
You should use that food to feed your people.
Send Huayna Capac some of those treasures. He loves surprises.
Huayna Capac does not appreciate you stealing what belongs to him.
You may borrow Huayna Capac's subject for a short amount of time.
Huayna Capac knows the value of good servants.
May you spend that wood wisely.
Huayna Capac has claimed a treasure. This will aid us in our plans.
More food for Huayna Capac's granaries!
Huayna Capac can use this tribute well. He thanks you for sending it to him.
Even more tributes! Huayna Capac is pleased.
The natives are eager to follow Huayna Capac into battle.
These villagers will help grow Huayna Capac's empire.
More wood to arm my numerous forces!
These walls will protect Huayna Capac's people while his warriors go on the offensive.
It is only a matter of time until Huayna Capac is victorious. Start preparing the feasts!
Huayna Capac's troops will strike where you least expect.
Huayna Capac is victorious yet again. His empire grows.
You are quick to advance, but what use is it if you rule no people?
Huayna Capac has dealt with primitive tribes like yours before.
Why fight? Just accept Huayna Capac's superiority and we can end this now.
Huayna Capac sees that you can finally train an army. He has been waiting all day for someone to actually put up a fight!
The Inca value community. Huayna Capac guesses that you prefer isolation.
You cluster together like a litter of frightened guinea pigs.
Huayna Capac has not laughed like this in a long time. Thank you for that!
I am Huayna Capac, Emperor of the Inca. I answer to no mere mortal!
Last time, Huayna Capac sent his cook to fight for him. Now, he will deal with your pathetic army himself!
There is an even easier way out of this. Just surrender and become Huayna Capac's subject.
Huayna Capac sees that you have fallen in love with this corner of the Inca Empire.
Gather all of the allies that you can find! You will need them to face the might of the Inca Empire.
Huayna Capac thinks that you are brave and confident to fight against such odds. He also thinks that you are a fool!
Another tourist? Machu Picchu is closed today.
Huayna Capac already knew that your warriors would come. His messengers informed him.
Huayna Capac assumes that these warriors want to join the mighty Inca army?
You command a big army! Impressive...now, what are they doing here?
Ahh! You have brought some weapons to trade, yes?
The subjects that you have sent Huayna Capac are too numerous and too unruly. Take them back!
Are you sending your people to negotiate your surrender? Then where are the gifts for Huayna Capac?
Huayna Capac's scouts have found your small kingdom. When will it join his mighty empire?
You have letters and numbers, I prefer to pull the strings with my quipus!
Your power is overwhelming. Huayna Capac surrenders for the good of his people.
My empire is suffering. Huayna Capac has no choice but to concede.
Do you feel safe now? Huayna Capac thinks that you should not.
Huayna Capac sees that you have gathered the first treasure. Do not let that get to your head.
Treasures alone will not let you catch up with the mighty Inca.
Oh, you found gold. Surely you mean to tribute that to Huayna Capac?
May that food keep you alive a little longer. It cannot compare to the contents of Huayna Capac's granaries.
He who hoards all of the earth's bounties but does not share it with the gods is his own undoing.
You are blinded by greed, we Inca share our goods.
Inca punishments for theft are infamous.
Are you misleading the beloved subjects of the Sapa Inca?
Huayna Capac rules enough people already.
Are you trying to become a master builder like Huayna Capac? You are a fool—you must use stone!
The Inca build the best walls. We know how to overcome yours!
The Inca Empire keeps growing. Can yours keep up?
This trading site belongs to Huayna Capac, as do all others.
All that you can see belongs to the Sapa Inca!
Even Mother Earth pays tribute to the Inca.
Something to eat! I hope that it is not quinoa again.
I consider this your due tribute to your overlord.
Inti shows us where all of the treasures are!
The natives of this land are wise. They prefer to join the Inca.
More hands to do hard labor for the Sapa Inca!
These villagers will build some fine roads and bridges!
With this wood, our bonfires for the gods will burn even brighter!
These natives won't follow you for long, the Inca Empire is preparing to expand.
Cheer while you can. Soon this trading site will belong to the Sapa Inca!
Why do you cower behind your Trading Posts? Face the Inca on the battlefield like a real general would!
Huayna Capac has all of the power now. I would start considering the idea of finding a new home.
